arabicText: وَتَرَى ٱلْجِبَالَ تَحْسَبُهَا جَامِدَةًۭ وَهِىَ تَمُرُّ مَرَّ ٱلسَّحَابِ ۚ صُنْعَ ٱللَّهِ ٱلَّذِىٓ أَتْقَنَ كُلَّ شَىْءٍ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ خَبِيرٌۢ بِمَا تَفْعَلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	you	will	see	the	mountains	presuming	them	fixed	whereas	they	will	be	moving	like	the	
clouds;	this	is	Allah’s	making,	Who	created	all	things	with	wisdom;	indeed	He	is	Informed	of	what	
you	do.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	tu	dekhe	ga	pahādoñ	ko	khayāl	karega	ke	woh	jame	huwe	haiñ	aur	woh	chalte	hoñ	ge	bādal	
ki	chāl	ye	kām	hai	Allāh	ka	jis	ne	ḥikmat	se	banāi	har	chiz	be-shak	usey	khabar	hai	tumhāre	kāmoñ	
ki.

arabicText: مَن جَآءَ بِٱلْحَسَنَةِ فَلَهُۥ خَيْرٌۭ مِّنْهَا وَهُم مِّن فَزَعٍۢ يَوْمَئِذٍ ءَامِنُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Whoever	brings	a	good	deed	–	for	him	is	a	
reward	better	than	it;	and	they	will	be	safe	
from	the	terror	on	that	Day.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jo	neki	lāye	us	ke	liye	us	se	bahtar	sila	hai	
aur	un	ko	us	din	ki	ghabrāhat	se	amān	hai.

arabicText: وَمَن جَآءَ بِٱلسَّيِّئَةِ فَكُبَّتْ وُجُوهُهُمْ فِى ٱلنَّارِ هَلْ تُجْزَوْنَ إِلَّا مَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	whoever	brings	evil	–	so	their	faces	
will	be	dipped	into	the	fire;	what	reward	
will	you	get,	except	what	you	did?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jo	badi	lāye	to	un	ke	muñh	auñdhāye	
gaye	āag	meiñ	tumheñ	kya	badla	mile	ga	
magar	usi	kā	jo	karte	the.

arabicText: إِنَّمَآ أُمِرْتُ أَنْ أَعْبُدَ رَبَّ هَـٰذِهِ ٱلْبَلْدَةِ ٱلَّذِى حَرَّمَهَا وَلَهُۥ كُلُّ شَىْءٍۢ ۖ وَأُمِرْتُ أَنْ أَكُونَ مِنَ ٱلْمُسْلِمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
“I	(Prophet	Muhammad	-	peace	and	blessings	
be	upon	him)	have	been	commanded	to	
worship	the	Lord	of	this	city,	Who	has	
deemed	it	sacred,	and	everything	belongs	to	
Him;	and	I	have	been	commanded	to	be	
among	the	obedient.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Mujhe	to	yahi	ḥukm	huwa	hai	ke	poojoñ	us	
shahar	ke	Rab	ko	jis	ne	use	ḥurmat	wālā	
kiya	aur	sab	kuchh	usi	kā	hai	aur	mujhe	
ḥukm	huwā	hai	ke	farmāñ	bardāroñ	meiñ	
ho	ouñ.

arabicText: وَأَنْ أَتْلُوَا۟ ٱلْقُرْءَانَ ۖ فَمَنِ ٱهْتَدَىٰ فَإِنَّمَا يَهْتَدِى لِنَفْسِهِۦ ۖ وَمَن ضَلَّ فَقُلْ إِنَّمَآ أَنَا۠ مِنَ ٱلْمُنذِرِينَ
englishTranslationText:
“And	to	recite	the	Qur’an”;	so	whoever	
attained	the	right	path,	has	attained	it	for	
his	own	good;	and	whoever	goes	astray	–	
so	say,	“Indeed	I	am	only	a	Herald	of	
Warning.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	ye	ke	Qur'ān	ki	tilāwat	karoñ	to	jis	ne	
rāh	pāyi	us	ne	apne	bhale	ko	rāh	pāyi	aur	
jo	bahke	to	farmā	do	ke	maiñ	to	yahi	dar	
sunāne	wālā	hoñ.

arabicText: وَقُلِ ٱلْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ سَيُرِيكُمْ ءَايَـٰتِهِۦ فَتَعْرِفُونَهَا ۚ وَمَا رَبُّكَ بِغَـٰفِلٍ عَمَّا تَعْمَلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	proclaim,	“All	praise	is	to	Allah	–	He	
will	soon	show	you	His	signs	so	you	will	
recognise	them”;	and	(O	dear	Prophet	
Muhammad	–	peace	and	blessings	be	upon	
him)	your	Lord	is	not	unaware	of	what	you,	
O	people,	do.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	farmāō	ke	sab	khobyāñ	Allāh	ke	liye	
haiñ	án-qarib	woh	tumheñ	apni	
nishāniyāñ	dikhāye	ga	to	unheñ	pahchān	
loge	aur	aye	maḥbob!	tumhārā	Rab	ghāfil	
nahiñ	aye	logoñ	tumhāre	a’amāl	se.

arabicText: طسٓمٓ
englishTranslationText:
Ta-Seen-Meem*.(*Alphabets	of	the	Arabic	language;	Allah	and	to	whomever	He	reveals,	know	their	precise	
meanings.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Ta-Seen-Meem	
(*Arabi	zabān	k	Huroof	jinke	Ma’āni	Allah	or	Jis	
par	Allah	Ta’āla	ne	Inko	Nazil	Farmaya	Wahi	Janta	hai.)

arabicText: تِلْكَ ءَايَـٰتُ ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ ٱلْمُبِينِ
englishTranslationText: These	are	verses	of	the	clear	Book.
romanUrduTranslationText: Ye	Āayateñ	haiñ	roshan	Kitāb	ki.

arabicText: نَتْلُوا۟ عَلَيْكَ مِن نَّبَإِ مُوسَىٰ وَفِرْعَوْنَ بِٱلْحَقِّ لِقَوْمٍۢ يُؤْمِنُونَ
englishTranslationText: We	shall	narrate	to	you	the	true	tidings	of	Moosa	and	Firaun,	for	the	people	who	have	faith.
romanUrduTranslationText: Ham	tum	par	padheñ	Mūsā	aur	Fir’aun	ki	sachchi	khabar	un	logoñ	ke	liye	jo	Imān	rakhte	haiñ.

arabicText: إِنَّ فِرْعَوْنَ عَلَا فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَجَعَلَ أَهْلَهَا شِيَعًۭا يَسْتَضْعِفُ طَآئِفَةًۭ مِّنْهُمْ يُذَبِّحُ أَبْنَآءَهُمْ وَيَسْتَحْىِۦ نِسَآءَهُمْ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ مِنَ ٱلْمُفْسِدِينَ
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	Firaun	had	achieved	dominance	in	the	earth	and	made	its	people	subservient	to	him	–	seeing	a	group	
among	them	weak,	he	used	to	kill	their	sons	and	spare	their	women;	he	was	indeed	very	mischievous.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	Fir’aun	ne	zameen	meiñ	ghalba	pāyā	aur	us(zameen)	ke	logon	ko	apnā	tāb’e	banā	liyā	un	meiñ	aik	
giroh	ko	kamzor	dekhtā	un	ke	betoñ	ko	ƶibaḥ	kartā	aur	un	ki	áuratoñ	ko	zinda	rakhtā	be-shak	woh	fasādi	
thā.

arabicText: وَنُرِيدُ أَن نَّمُنَّ عَلَى ٱلَّذِينَ ٱسْتُضْعِفُوا۟ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَنَجْعَلَهُمْ أَئِمَّةًۭ وَنَجْعَلَهُمُ ٱلْوَٰرِثِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	We	willed	to	favour	those	who	were	weak	in	the	earth,	and	to	make	them	leaders	and	to	make	them	
the	inheritors	(of	the	land	and	wealth	of	Firaun’s	people).
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	ham	chāhte	the	ke	un	kamzoroñ	par	iḥsān	farmāyeñ	aur	un	ko	peshwā	banāyeñ	aur	un	ke	mulk	wa	māl	
ka	unhiñ	ko	wāris	banāyeñ.

arabicText: وَنُمَكِّنَ لَهُمْ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَنُرِىَ فِرْعَوْنَ وَهَـٰمَـٰنَ وَجُنُودَهُمَا مِنْهُم مَّا كَانُوا۟ يَحْذَرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	to	give	them	control	in	the	land,	and	to	
show	Firaun	and	Haman	and	their	armies	
what	they	fear	from	them.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	unheñ	zameen	meiñ	qabza	deñ	aur	
fir’aun	aur	hāmān	aur	un	ke	lashkaroñ	ko	
wohi	dikhā	deñ	jis	kā	unheñ	in	ki	ṭaraf	se	
khaṭra	hai.

arabicText: وَأَوْحَيْنَآ إِلَىٰٓ أُمِّ مُوسَىٰٓ أَنْ أَرْضِعِيهِ ۖ فَإِذَا خِفْتِ عَلَيْهِ فَأَلْقِيهِ فِى ٱلْيَمِّ وَلَا تَخَافِى وَلَا تَحْزَنِىٓ ۖ إِنَّا رَآدُّوهُ إِلَيْكِ وَجَاعِلُوهُ مِنَ ٱلْمُرْسَلِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	We	inspired	the	mother	of	Moosa	that,	
“Suckle	him;	then	when	you	fear	for	him,	
cast	him	into	the	river	and	do	not	fear	nor	
grieve;	We	shall	indeed	return	him	back	to	
you	and	make	him	one	of	the	Noble	
Messengers.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Ham	ne	Mūsā	ki	mā	ko	ilhām	farmāyā	
ke	use	dodh	pilā	phir	jab	tujhe	us	se	
andesha	ho	to	usey	daryā	meiñ	dāl	de	aur	
na	dar	aur	na	gham	kar	be-shak	ham	usey	
teri	ṭaraf	pher	lāyeñ	ge	aur	usey	Rasool	
banāyeñ	ge.

arabicText: فَٱلْتَقَطَهُۥٓ ءَالُ فِرْعَوْنَ لِيَكُونَ لَهُمْ عَدُوًّۭا وَحَزَنًا ۗ إِنَّ فِرْعَوْنَ وَهَـٰمَـٰنَ وَجُنُودَهُمَا كَانُوا۟ خَـٰطِـِٔينَ
englishTranslationText:
So	the	family	of	Firaun	picked	him	up,	in	
order	that	he	become	their	enemy	and	a	
sorrow	upon	them;	indeed	Firaun	and	
Haman	and	their	armies	were	guilty.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	usey	uthā	liyā	Fir’aun	ke	ghar	wāloñ	ne	
ke	woh	un	kā	dushman	aur	un	par	gham	ho	
be-shak	fir’aun	aur	hāmān	aur	un	ke	
lashkar	khaṭā	kār	the.

arabicText: وَقَالَتِ ٱمْرَأَتُ فِرْعَوْنَ قُرَّتُ عَيْنٍۢ لِّى وَلَكَ ۖ لَا تَقْتُلُوهُ عَسَىٰٓ أَن يَنفَعَنَآ أَوْ نَتَّخِذَهُۥ وَلَدًۭا وَهُمْ لَا يَشْعُرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	Firaun’s	wife	said,	“This	child	is	the	
comfort	of	my	eyes	and	yours	*;	do	not	kill	
him;	perhaps	he	may	benefit	us,	or	we	may	
adopt	him	as	our	son”	-	and	they	were	
unaware.	(Had	Firaun	also	said	the	same,	
Allah	would	have	granted	him	faith.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	fir’aun	ki	bibi	ne	kahā	ye	bachcha	meri	
aur	teri	āankhoñ	ki	thandak	hai	ise	qatl	na	
karo	shāyad	ye	hameñ	nafa’a	de	yā	ham	ise	
beta	banā	leñ	aur	woh	be-khabar	the.

arabicText: وَأَصْبَحَ فُؤَادُ أُمِّ مُوسَىٰ فَـٰرِغًا ۖ إِن كَادَتْ لَتُبْدِى بِهِۦ لَوْلَآ أَن رَّبَطْنَا عَلَىٰ قَلْبِهَا لِتَكُونَ مِنَ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	in	the	morning,	the	heart	of	Moosa’s	
mother	became	impatient;	and	she	would	
have	almost	certainly	given	away	his	
secret	had	We	not	strengthened	her	heart,	
so	that	she	may	have	faith	in	Our	promise.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	subaḥ	ko	Mūsā	ki	māñ	kā	dil	be-sabar	
ho	gayā	zaror	qarib	thā	ke	woh	us	kā	ḥāl	
khol	deti	agar	ham	na	dhāras	bandhāte	us	ke	dil	par	ke	usey	hamāre	w’ade	par	yaqin	rahe.

arabicText: وَقَالَتْ لِأُخْتِهِۦ قُصِّيهِ ۖ فَبَصُرَتْ بِهِۦ عَن جُنُبٍۢ وَهُمْ لَا يَشْعُرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	she	said	to	his	sister,	“Go	after	him”	-	
she	therefore	observed	him	from	far,	and	they	were	not	aware.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur(us	ki	māñ	ne)	us	ki	bahan	se	kahā	us	ke	peeche	chali	jā	to	woh	usey	dor	se	dekhti	rahi	aur	un	
ko	khabar	na	thi.

arabicText: ۞ وَحَرَّمْنَا عَلَيْهِ ٱلْمَرَاضِعَ مِن قَبْلُ فَقَالَتْ هَلْ أَدُلُّكُمْ عَلَىٰٓ أَهْلِ بَيْتٍۢ يَكْفُلُونَهُۥ لَكُمْ وَهُمْ لَهُۥ نَـٰصِحُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	We	had	already	forbidden	suckle-nurses	for	him,	so	she	said,	“Shall	I	show	you	a	household	
that	will	nurse	this	child	of	yours,	and	they	are	his	well-wishers?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	ham	ne	pahle	hi	sab	dāiyāñ	us	par	ḥarām	kar	di	thin	to	boli	kyā	maiñ	tumheñ	batā	doñ	aise	
ghar	wale	ke	tumhāre	is	bachche	ko	pāl	deñ	aur	woh	is	ke	khair-khuawh	haiñ.

arabicText: فَرَدَدْنَـٰهُ إِلَىٰٓ أُمِّهِۦ كَىْ تَقَرَّ عَيْنُهَا وَلَا تَحْزَنَ وَلِتَعْلَمَ أَنَّ وَعْدَ ٱللَّهِ حَقٌّۭ وَلَـٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَهُمْ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
So	We	returned	him	to	his	mother	in	order	to	soothe	her	eyes	and	not	grieve,	and	to	know	that	
Allah’s	promise	is	true	–	but	most	people	do	not	know.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	Ham	ne	usey	us	ki	mā	ki	ṭaraf	pherā	ke	mā	ki	āankh	thandi	ho	aur	gham	na	khāye	aur	jān	le	ke	
Allāh	kā	w’ada	sachchā	hai	lekin	aksar	log	nahiñ	jānte.

arabicText: وَلَمَّا بَلَغَ أَشُدَّهُۥ وَٱسْتَوَىٰٓ ءَاتَيْنَـٰهُ حُكْمًۭا وَعِلْمًۭا ۚ وَكَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِى ٱلْمُحْسِنِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	when	he	reached	his	maturity	and	full	
strength,	We	gave	him	wisdom	and	
knowledge;	and	this	is	how	We	reward	the	
virtuous.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jab	apni	jawani	ko	phuñchā	aur	poore	
zor	par	āayā	Ham	ne	usey	ḥukm	aur	‘ilm	
átā	farmāyā	aur	Ham	aisā	hi	sila	dete	haiñ	
naikoñ	ko.

arabicText: وَدَخَلَ ٱلْمَدِينَةَ عَلَىٰ حِينِ غَفْلَةٍۢ مِّنْ أَهْلِهَا فَوَجَدَ فِيهَا رَجُلَيْنِ يَقْتَتِلَانِ هَـٰذَا مِن شِيعَتِهِۦ وَهَـٰذَا مِنْ عَدُوِّهِۦ ۖ فَٱسْتَغَـٰثَهُ ٱلَّذِى مِن شِيعَتِهِۦ عَلَى ٱلَّذِى مِنْ عَدُوِّهِۦ فَوَكَزَهُۥ مُوسَىٰ فَقَضَىٰ عَلَيْهِ ۖ قَالَ هَـٰذَا مِنْ عَمَلِ ٱلشَّيْطَـٰنِ ۖ إِنَّهُۥ عَدُوٌّۭ مُّضِلٌّۭ مُّبِينٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
And	he	entered	the	city	when	its	
inhabitants	were	sleeping	unaware	in	the	
afternoon	-	he	therefore	found	two	men	
fighting;	one	was	from	Moosa’s	group,	and	
the	other	from	among	his	enemies;	so	the	
one	who	was	of	Moosa’s	group	pleaded	to	
Moosa	for	help	against	him	who	was	of	his	
enemies	-	therefore	Moosa	punched	him	
thereby	finishing	him;	he	said,	“This	act	
was	from	the	devil	*;	indeed	he	is	an	open	
enemy,	a	misleader.”	(*	The	act	of	
oppressing	the	man	from	Bani	Israel).
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	us	shahar	meiñ	dākhil	hua	jis	waqt	
shahar	wāle	dopahar	ke	khuwāb	meiñ	be
khabar	the	to	us	meiñ	do	mard	ladte	pāye	
aik	Mūsā	ke	giroh	se	thā	aur	doosrā	us	ke	
dushmanoñ	se	to	woh	jo	us	ke	giroh	se	thā	
us	ne	Mūsā	se	madad	māñgi	us	par	jo	us	ke	
dushmnoñ	se	thā	to	Mūsā	ne	us	ke	ghonsā	
mārā	to	us	kā	kām	tamām	kar	diyā	kahā	ye	
kām	shaiṭān	ki	ṭaraf	se	huwā*	be-shak	woh	
dushman	hai	khulā	gumrāh	karne	wālā.	
(*yāni	us	Qitbi	ka	Israili	par	zulm	karna	jo	
uski	halakat	ka	bā’is	hua.)

arabicText: قَالَ رَبِّ إِنِّى ظَلَمْتُ نَفْسِى فَٱغْفِرْ لِى فَغَفَرَ لَهُۥٓ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ هُوَ ٱلْغَفُورُ ٱلرَّحِيمُ
englishTranslationText:
He	said,	“My	Lord!	I	have	indeed	wronged	
my	soul	*	therefore	forgive	me”	–	He	
therefore	forgave	him;	indeed	only	He	is	
the	Oft	Forgiving,	the	Most	Merciful.	(*	By	
getting	angry.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Árz	ki	aye	mere	Rab	maiñ	ne	apni	jān	par	
zyādti	ki	to	mujhe	bakhsh	de	to	Rab	ne	
usey	bakhsh	diyā	be-shak	wohi	bakhshne	
wālā	maharbān	hai.

arabicText: قَالَ رَبِّ بِمَآ أَنْعَمْتَ عَلَىَّ فَلَنْ أَكُونَ ظَهِيرًۭا لِّلْمُجْرِمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
He	said,	“My	Lord!	The	way	You	have	
bestowed	favour	upon	me,	so	never	will	I	
be	a	supporter	of	the	guilty.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Árz	ki	aye	mere	Rab	jaisā	to	ne	mujh	par	
eḥsān	kiyā	to	ab	hargiz	maiñ	mujrimoñ	kā	
madadgār	no	ho	ouñga.

arabicText: فَأَصْبَحَ فِى ٱلْمَدِينَةِ خَآئِفًۭا يَتَرَقَّبُ فَإِذَا ٱلَّذِى ٱسْتَنصَرَهُۥ بِٱلْأَمْسِ يَسْتَصْرِخُهُۥ ۚ قَالَ لَهُۥ مُوسَىٰٓ إِنَّكَ لَغَوِىٌّۭ مُّبِينٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
So	he	was	in	the	city	at	morning	fearing,	
waiting	to	see	what	happens	–	thereupon	
he	sighted	the	one	who	had	appealed	to	
him	the	day	before,	crying	out	to	him	for	
help;	Moosa	said	to	him,	“Indeed	you	are	
clearly	astray.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	subaḥ	ki	us	shahar	meiñ	darte	huwe	is	
intzar	meiñ	ke	kyā	hotā	hai	jabhi	dekhā	ke	
woh	jis	ne	kal	in	se	madad	cāhi	thi	faryād	
kar	rahā	hai	Mūsā	ne	us	se	farmāyā	be
shak	to	khulā	gumrāh	hai.

arabicText: فَلَمَّآ أَنْ أَرَادَ أَن يَبْطِشَ بِٱلَّذِى هُوَ عَدُوٌّۭ لَّهُمَا قَالَ يَـٰمُوسَىٰٓ أَتُرِيدُ أَن تَقْتُلَنِى كَمَا قَتَلْتَ نَفْسًۢا بِٱلْأَمْسِ ۖ إِن تُرِيدُ إِلَّآ أَن تَكُونَ جَبَّارًۭا فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَمَا تُرِيدُ أَن تَكُونَ مِنَ ٱلْمُصْلِحِينَ
englishTranslationText:
So	when	Moosa	wished	to	apprehend	the	man	who	was	an	enemy	to	them	both,	he	said,	“O	
Moosa!	Do	you	wish	to	kill	me	the	way	you	killed	a	man	yesterday?	You	only	wish	to	become	a	
strict	ruler	in	the	land,	and	not	to	make	reform.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	jab	Mūsā	ne	chāhā	ke	us	par	girift	kare	jo	un	donoñ	kā	dushman	hai	woh	bolā	aye	Mūsā	kyā	
tum	mujhe	waisā	hi	qatl	karnā	chāhte	ho	jaisā	tum	ne	kal	aik	skakhs	ko	qatl	kar	diyā	tum	to	yahi	
chāhte	ho	ke	zameen	meiñ	sakht	geer	bano	aur		islāḥ	karnā	nahiñ	chāhte.

arabicText: فَوَجَآءَ رَجُلٌۭ مِّنْ أَقْصَا ٱلْمَدِينَةِ يَسْعَىٰ قَالَ يَـٰمُوسَىٰٓ إِنَّ ٱلْمَلَأَ يَأْتَمِرُونَ بِكَ لِيَقْتُلُوكَ فَٱخْرُجْ إِنِّى لَكَ مِنَ ٱلنَّـٰصِحِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	a	man	came	running	from	the	outer	part	of	the	city;	he	said,	“O	Moosa!	Indeed	the	court	
members	are	considering	killing	you,	therefore	go	away	-	I	surely	am	your	well-wisher.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	shahar	ke	parle	kināre	se	aik	shakhs	daudtā	āayā	kahā	aey	Mūsā	be-shak	darbār	wāle	āap	ke	
qatl	kā	mashwara	kar	rahe	haiñ	to	nikal	jāiye	maiñ	āap	kā	khair-khwāh	hoñ.

arabicText: فَخَرَجَ مِنْهَا خَآئِفًۭا يَتَرَقَّبُ ۖ قَالَ رَبِّ نَجِّنِى مِنَ ٱلْقَوْمِ ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
So	he	left	the	city	in	fear,	waiting	to	see	what	happens;	he	said,	“My	Lord!	Rescue	me	from	the	
unjust	people.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	us	shahar	se	niklā	dartā	huwā	is	intizar	meiñ	ke	ab	kyā	hoṭa	hai	árz	ki	aey	mere	Rab	mujhe	
sitamgāroñ	se	bachā	le.

arabicText: وَلَمَّا تَوَجَّهَ تِلْقَآءَ مَدْيَنَ قَالَ عَسَىٰ رَبِّىٓ أَن يَهْدِيَنِى سَوَآءَ ٱلسَّبِيلِ
englishTranslationText:
And	when	he	turned	his	attention	towards	
Madyan	he	said,	“It	is	likely	that	my	Lord	
will	show	me	the	right	path.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jab	Madyan	ki	ṭaraf	mutawajjah	huā	
kahā	qarib	ke	merā	Rab	mujhe	sidhi	rāh	
batāye.

arabicText: وَلَمَّا وَرَدَ مَآءَ مَدْيَنَ وَجَدَ عَلَيْهِ أُمَّةًۭ مِّنَ ٱلنَّاسِ يَسْقُونَ وَوَجَدَ مِن دُونِهِمُ ٱمْرَأَتَيْنِ تَذُودَانِ ۖ قَالَ مَا خَطْبُكُمَا ۖ قَالَتَا لَا نَسْقِى حَتَّىٰ يُصْدِرَ ٱلرِّعَآءُ ۖ وَأَبُونَا شَيْخٌۭ كَبِيرٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
And	when	he	came	to	the	water	of	Madyan	
he	found	a	group	of	men,	watering	their	
animals;	and	away	from	them	he	found	
two	women	restraining	their	animals;	he	
said,	“What	is	the	matter	with	you?”	They	
said,	“We	do	not	water	our	animals	till	all	
the	shepherds	water	and	take	away	their	
animals;	and	our	father	is	very	old.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jab	Madyan	ke	pāni	par	āayā	wahāñ	
logon	ke	aik	giroh	ko	dekhā	ke	apne	
jānwaroñ	ko	pāni	pilā	rahe	haiñ	aur	un	se	
is	ṭaraf	do	áurateñ	dekhiñ	ke	apne	
jānwaroñ	ko	rok	rahi	haiñ	Mūsā	ne	
farmāyā	tum	donoñ	kā	kyā	ḥāl	hai	woh	
boliñ	ham	pāni	nahiñ	pilāte	jab	tak	sab	
charwāhe	pilā	kar	pher	na	le	jāyeñ	aur	
hamāre	bāp	bahut	boodhe	haiñ.

arabicText: فَسَقَىٰ لَهُمَا ثُمَّ تَوَلَّىٰٓ إِلَى ٱلظِّلِّ فَقَالَ رَبِّ إِنِّى لِمَآ أَنزَلْتَ إِلَىَّ مِنْ خَيْرٍۢ فَقِيرٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
Therefore	Moosa	watered	their	animals	
for	them,	and	then	turned	towards	the	
shade	and	said,	“My	Lord!	I	am	in	need	of	
the	sustenance	you	may	send	down	for	
me.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	Mūsā	ne	un	donoñ	ke	jānwaroñ	ko	pāni	
pilā	diyā	phir	sāye	ki	ṭaraf	phirā	árz	ki	aey	
mere	Rab	maiñ	is	khāne	kā	jo	tu	mere	liye	
utāre	muḥtāj	hoñ.

arabicText: فَجَآءَتْهُ إِحْدَىٰهُمَا تَمْشِى عَلَى ٱسْتِحْيَآءٍۢ قَالَتْ إِنَّ أَبِى يَدْعُوكَ لِيَجْزِيَكَ أَجْرَ مَا سَقَيْتَ لَنَا ۚ فَلَمَّا جَآءَهُۥ وَقَصَّ عَلَيْهِ ٱلْقَصَصَ قَالَ لَا تَخَفْ ۖ نَجَوْتَ مِنَ ٱلْقَوْمِ ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
So	one	of	the	two	women	approached	him,	
walking	shyly;	she	said,	“My	father	is	
calling	you,	in	order	to	give	you	wages	
because	you	watered	our	animals	for	us”;	
when	Moosa	came	to	him	and	had	told	him	
the	story,	he	said,	“Do	not	fear,	you	are	safe	
from	the	unjust	people.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	un	donoñ	meiñ	se	aik	us	ke	pās	āayi	
sharam	se	chalti	huwi	boli	merā	bāp	tumhe	
bulātā	hai	ke	tumheñ	mazdori	de	us	ki	jo	
tum	ne	hamāre	jānwaroñ	ko	pāni	pilāyā	
hai	jab	Mūsā	us	ke	pās	āayā	aur	use	bāteñ	
kah	sunāyiñ	us	ne	kahā	dariye	nahiñ	āap	
bach	gaye	zālimoñ	se.

arabicText: قَالَتْ إِحْدَىٰهُمَا يَـٰٓأَبَتِ ٱسْتَـْٔجِرْهُ ۖ إِنَّ خَيْرَ مَنِ ٱسْتَـْٔجَرْتَ ٱلْقَوِىُّ ٱلْأَمِينُ
englishTranslationText:
One	of	the	two	women	said,	“O	my	father!	
Employ	him	–	indeed	a	strong	and	
trustworthy	employee	is	better.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Un	meiñ	ki	aik	boli	aey	mere	bāp	in	ko	
noukar	rakh	lo	be-shak	bahtar	noukar	woh	jo	ṭaqatwar	amānatdār	ho.

arabicText: قَالَ إِنِّىٓ أُرِيدُ أَنْ أُنكِحَكَ إِحْدَى ٱبْنَتَىَّ هَـٰتَيْنِ عَلَىٰٓ أَن تَأْجُرَنِى ثَمَـٰنِىَ حِجَجٍۢ ۖ فَإِنْ أَتْمَمْتَ عَشْرًۭا فَمِنْ عِندِكَ ۖ وَمَآ أُرِيدُ أَنْ أَشُقَّ عَلَيْكَ ۚ سَتَجِدُنِىٓ إِن شَآءَ ٱللَّهُ مِنَ ٱلصَّـٰلِحِينَ
englishTranslationText:
He	said,	“I	wish	to	give	you	one	of	these	
two	daughters	of	mine	in	marriage,	the	bridal	money	being	that	you	work	for	me	for	eight	years;	
then	if	you	complete	ten	years,	it	will	be	from	you;	and	I	do	not	wish	to	put	you	in	hardship;	Allah	
willing,	you	will	probably	find	me	of	the	righteous.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kahā	maiñ	chāhtā	hoñ	ke	apni	in	donoñ	betiyoñ	meiñ	se	aik	tumhe	biyāh	doñ	is	mahar	par	ke	
tum	āath	baras	meri	mulāzamat	karo	phir	agar	poore	das	baras	kar	lo	to	tumhāri	ṭaraf	se	hai	aur	
maiñ	tumhe	mashaqqat	meiñ	dālnā	nahiñ	chāhtā	qarib	hai	in	Sha	Allāh	ta’āla	tum	mujhe	nekoñ	
meiñ	pāōge.

arabicText: قَالَ ذَٰلِكَ بَيْنِى وَبَيْنَكَ ۖ أَيَّمَا ٱلْأَجَلَيْنِ قَضَيْتُ فَلَا عُدْوَٰنَ عَلَىَّ ۖ وَٱللَّهُ عَلَىٰ مَا نَقُولُ وَكِيلٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
Said	Moosa,	“This	is	agreed	between	me	and	you;	there	shall	be	no	claim	upon	me	if	I	fulfil	any	of	
these	two	terms;	and	Allah	is	the	Trustee	upon	this	word	of	ours.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Mūsā	ne	kahā	ye	mere	aur	āap	ke	darmiyān	iqrār	ho	chuka	maiñ	in	donoñ	meiñ	jo	mi’aad	pori	kar	
doñ	to	mujh	par	koi	muṭalaba	nahiñ	aur	hamāre	is	kahe	par	Allāh	ka	ƶimma	hai.

arabicText: ۞ فَلَمَّا قَضَىٰ مُوسَى ٱلْأَجَلَ وَسَارَ بِأَهْلِهِۦٓ ءَانَسَ مِن جَانِبِ ٱلطُّورِ نَارًۭا قَالَ لِأَهْلِهِ ٱمْكُثُوٓا۟ إِنِّىٓ ءَانَسْتُ نَارًۭا لَّعَلِّىٓ ءَاتِيكُم مِّنْهَا بِخَبَرٍ أَوْ جَذْوَةٍۢ مِّنَ ٱلنَّارِ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَصْطَلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
So	when	Moosa	completed	his	term	and	
was	travelling	with	his	wife,	he	saw	a	fire	
in	the	direction	of	the	Mount;	he	said	to	his	
wife,	“Stay	here	-	I	have	sighted	a	fire	in	the	
direction	of	the	mount	–	perhaps	I	may	
bring	you	some	news	from	it,	or	an	ember	
so	that	you	may	warm	yourselves.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	jab	Mūsā	ne	apni	mi’aad	pori	kar	di	
aur	apni	bibi	ko	le	kar	chalā	Ṭoor	ki	ṭaraf	
se	aik	āag	dekhi	apni	ghar	wāli	se	kahā	tum	
thahro	mujhe	Ṭoor	ki	ṭaraf	se	aik	āag	nazar	
padi	hai	shāyad	maiñ	wahāñ	se	kuch	
khabar	lāoñ	yā	tumhāre	liye	koi	āag	ki	
chingāri	lāoñ	ke	tum	tāpo.

arabicText: فَلَمَّآ أَتَىٰهَا نُودِىَ مِن شَـٰطِئِ ٱلْوَادِ ٱلْأَيْمَنِ فِى ٱلْبُقْعَةِ ٱلْمُبَـٰرَكَةِ مِنَ ٱلشَّجَرَةِ أَن يَـٰمُوسَىٰٓ إِنِّىٓ أَنَا ٱللَّهُ رَبُّ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	when	he	reached	the	fire,	he	was	
called	out	to	from	the	right	side	of	the	
valley	in	the	blessed	field,	from	the	tree,	“O	
Moosa!	Indeed	I	am	truly	Allah,	the	Lord	Of	
The	Creation.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	jab	āag	ke	pās	ḥāzir	huā	nidā	ki	gai	
maidān	ke	dāhine	kināre	se	barkat	wāle	
maqām	meiñ	ped	se	ke	aey	Mūsā	be-shak	
maiñ	hi	hooñ	Allāh	Rab	sāre	jahān	kā.

arabicText: وَأَنْ أَلْقِ عَصَاكَ ۖ فَلَمَّا رَءَاهَا تَهْتَزُّ كَأَنَّهَا جَآنٌّۭ وَلَّىٰ مُدْبِرًۭا وَلَمْ يُعَقِّبْ ۚ يَـٰمُوسَىٰٓ أَقْبِلْ وَلَا تَخَفْ ۖ إِنَّكَ مِنَ ٱلْـَٔامِنِينَ
englishTranslationText:
“Put	down	your	staff”;	so	when	Moosa	saw	
it	writhing	like	a	serpent,	he	turned	
moving	away	without	looking	back;	“O	
Moosa!	Come	forth	and	do	not	fear;	indeed	
you	are	in	peace.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	ye	ke	dal	de	apnā	‘asā	phir	jab	Mūsā	ne	
usey	dekhā	lahrātā	huā	goyā	sānp	hai	
peeth	pher	kar	chalā	aur	mud	kar	na	dekhā	
aey	Mūsā	sāmne	āa	aur	dar	nahiñ	be-shak	
tujhe	amān	hai.

arabicText: ٱسْلُكْ يَدَكَ فِى جَيْبِكَ تَخْرُجْ بَيْضَآءَ مِنْ غَيْرِ سُوٓءٍۢ وَٱضْمُمْ إِلَيْكَ جَنَاحَكَ مِنَ ٱلرَّهْبِ ۖ فَذَٰنِكَ بُرْهَـٰنَانِ مِن رَّبِّكَ إِلَىٰ فِرْعَوْنَ وَمَلَإِي۟هِۦٓ ۚ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا۟ قَوْمًۭا فَـٰسِقِينَ
englishTranslationText:
“Put	your	hand	inside	your	armpit	-	it	will	
come	out	shining	white,	not	due	to	any	
illness;	and	put	your	hand	on	your	chest	to	
remove	the	fear	–	so	these	are	two	proofs	
from	your	Lord	to	Firaun	and	his	court	
members;	indeed	they	are	a	lawless	
people.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Apnā	hāth	girebān	meiñ	dāl	niklega	safed	
chamaktā	be-‘aib	aur	apnā	hāth	apne	sine	par	rakh	le	khauf	dor	karne	ko	to	ye	do	ḥujjteñ	haiñ	
tere	Rab	ki	Fir’aun	aur	us	ke	dabāriyoñ	ki	ṭaraf	be-shak	woh	be-ḥukm	(nā	farmān)	log	haiñ

arabicText: قَالَ رَبِّ إِنِّى قَتَلْتُ مِنْهُمْ نَفْسًۭا فَأَخَافُ أَن يَقْتُلُونِ
englishTranslationText:
He	submitted,	“My	Lord!	I	killed	a	soul	
among	them	and	I	fear	they	will	kill	me.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Árz	ki	aey	mere	Rab	maiñ	ne	un	meiñ	aik	jān	mār	dāli	hai	to	dartā	hooñ	ke	mujhe	qatl	kar	deñ.

arabicText: وَأَخِى هَـٰرُونُ هُوَ أَفْصَحُ مِنِّى لِسَانًۭا فَأَرْسِلْهُ مَعِىَ رِدْءًۭا يُصَدِّقُنِىٓ ۖ إِنِّىٓ أَخَافُ أَن يُكَذِّبُونِ
englishTranslationText:
“And	my	brother	Haroon	–	he	is	more	eloquent	than	I	am	in	speech,	therefore	in	order	to	help	
me,	appoint	him	as	a	Noble	Messenger	so	that	he	confirms	me;	I	fear	that	they	will	deny	me.”	”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	merā	bhāi	Hāroon	us	ki	zubān	mujh	se	ziyāda	sāf	hai	to	usey	meri	madad	ke	liye	Rasool	banā	
ke	meri	tasdeeq	kare	mujhe	dar	hai	ke	woh	mujhe	jhutlāyeñ	ge.

arabicText: قَالَ سَنَشُدُّ عَضُدَكَ بِأَخِيكَ وَنَجْعَلُ لَكُمَا سُلْطَـٰنًۭا فَلَا يَصِلُونَ إِلَيْكُمَا ۚ بِـَٔايَـٰتِنَآ أَنتُمَا وَمَنِ ٱتَّبَعَكُمَا ٱلْغَـٰلِبُونَ
englishTranslationText:
He	said,	“We	will	soon	strengthen	your	arm	with	your	brother,	and	give	you	both	dominance,	so	
they	will	not	be	able	to	harm	you;	due	to	Our	signs;	you	both,	and	those	who	will	follow	you,	will	
be	victorious.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Farmāya	Qarib	hai	ke	ham	tere	bāzoo	ko	tere	bhāi	se	quwwat	deñ	ge	aur	tum	donoñ	ko	ghalba	
‘aṭā	farmāyeñ	ge	to	woh	tum	donoñ	kā	kuch	nuqsān	na	kar	sakeñ	ge	hamāri	nishāniyoñ	ke	sabab	
tum	donoñ	aur	jo	tumhāri	pairwi	kareñ	ge	ghālib	āaō	ge.

arabicText: فَلَمَّا جَآءَهُم مُّوسَىٰ بِـَٔايَـٰتِنَا بَيِّنَـٰتٍۢ قَالُوا۟ مَا هَـٰذَآ إِلَّا سِحْرٌۭ مُّفْتَرًۭى وَمَا سَمِعْنَا بِهَـٰذَا فِىٓ ءَابَآئِنَا ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ
englishTranslationText:
Therefore	when	Moosa	came	to	them	with	
Our	clear	signs	they	said,	“This	is	nothing	
but	invented	magic,	and	we	never	heard	
anything	like	this	among	our	forefathers.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	jab	Mūsā	un	ke	pās	hamāri	raushan	
nishāniyañ	lāyā	bole	ye	to	nahiñ	magar	
banāwat	kā	jādo	aur	ham	ne	apne	agle	bāp	
dādāōñ	meiñ	aisā	na	sunā.

arabicText: وَقَالَ مُوسَىٰ رَبِّىٓ أَعْلَمُ بِمَن جَآءَ بِٱلْهُدَىٰ مِنْ عِندِهِۦ وَمَن تَكُونُ لَهُۥ عَـٰقِبَةُ ٱلدَّارِ ۖ إِنَّهُۥ لَا يُفْلِحُ ٱلظَّـٰلِمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	said	Moosa,	“My	Lord	well	knows	him	
who	has	brought	guidance	from	Him,	and	
for	whom	will	be	the	abode	the	Hereafter;	
indeed	the	unjust	never	attain	success.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Mūsā	ne	farmāyā	merā	Rab	khoob	
jāntā	hai	jo	us	ke	pās	se	hidāyat	lāyā	aur	jis	
ke	liye	āakhirat	ka	ghar	hogā	be-shak	zālim	
murād	ko	nahiñ	pahuñchte.

arabicText: وَقَالَ فِرْعَوْنُ يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلْمَلَأُ مَا عَلِمْتُ لَكُم مِّنْ إِلَـٰهٍ غَيْرِى فَأَوْقِدْ لِى يَـٰهَـٰمَـٰنُ عَلَى ٱلطِّينِ فَٱجْعَل لِّى صَرْحًۭا لَّعَلِّىٓ أَطَّلِعُ إِلَىٰٓ إِلَـٰهِ مُوسَىٰ وَإِنِّى لَأَظُنُّهُۥ مِنَ ٱلْكَـٰذِبِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	Firaun	said,	“O	court	members!	I	do	
not	know	of	any	other	God	for	you,	except	
myself;	therefore,	O	Haman,	build	a	lofty	
palace	for	me	by	baking	concrete	in	order	
that	I	may	sneak	a	look	at	the	God	of	Moosa	-	and	according	to	me,	he	is	indeed	a	liar
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Fir’aun	bola	aey	darbāryo!	maiñ	
tumhāre	liye	apne	siwā	koi	khudā	nahiñ	
jāntā	to	aey	hāmān	mere	liye	gārā	pakka	
kar	aik	maḥal	banā	ke	shāyad	maiñ	Mūsā	
ke	khudā	ko	jhānk	āaōñ	aur	be-shak	mere	
gumān	meiñ	to	woh	jhotā	hai.

arabicText: وَٱسْتَكْبَرَ هُوَ وَجُنُودُهُۥ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ بِغَيْرِ ٱلْحَقِّ وَظَنُّوٓا۟ أَنَّهُمْ إِلَيْنَا لَا يُرْجَعُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	he	and	his	soldiers	wrongfully	sought	
greatness	in	the	land,	and	assumed	they	
would	never	be	brought	back	to	Us.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	us	ne	aur	us	ke	lashkariyoñ	ne	zameen	
meiñ	be-jā	badāi	chāhi	aur	samjhe	ke	
unheñ	hamāri	ṭaraf	phirnā	nahiñ.

arabicText: فَأَخَذْنَـٰهُ وَجُنُودَهُۥ فَنَبَذْنَـٰهُمْ فِى ٱلْيَمِّ ۖ فَٱنظُرْ كَيْفَ كَانَ عَـٰقِبَةُ ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
We	therefore	seized	him	and	his	armies,	
and	hurled	them	into	the	sea;	therefore	see	
what	sort	of	fate	befell	the	unjust!
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	ham	ne	usey	aur	us	ke	lashkar	ko	pakad	kar	daryā	meiñ	phenk	diyā	to	dekho	kaisā	anjām	huā	
sitamgāroṇ	kā.

arabicText: وَجَعَلْنَـٰهُمْ أَئِمَّةًۭ يَدْعُونَ إِلَى ٱلنَّارِ ۖ وَيَوْمَ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ لَا يُنصَرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	We	made	them	leaders	of	the	people	
of	hell,	inviting	towards	the	fire;	and	they	
will	not	be	helped	on	the	Day	of	
Resurrection.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	unheñ	ham	ne	dozakhiyoñ	kā	paishwā	banāyā	ke	āag	ki	ṭaraf	bulāte	haiñ	aur	Qayāmat	ke	din	
un	ki	madad	na	hogi.

arabicText: وَأَتْبَعْنَـٰهُمْ فِى هَـٰذِهِ ٱلدُّنْيَا لَعْنَةًۭ ۖ وَيَوْمَ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ هُم مِّنَ ٱلْمَقْبُوحِينَ
englishTranslationText: And	We	set	a	curse	after	them	in	this	world;	and	evil	is	for	them	on	the	Day	of	Resurrection.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	is	dunyā	meiñ	ham	ne	un	ke	piche	l’anat	lagāi	aur	Qayāmat	ke	din	un	kā	burā	hai.

arabicText: وَلَقَدْ ءَاتَيْنَا مُوسَى ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ مِنۢ بَعْدِ مَآ أَهْلَكْنَا ٱلْقُرُونَ ٱلْأُولَىٰ بَصَآئِرَ لِلنَّاسِ وَهُدًۭى وَرَحْمَةًۭ لَّعَلَّهُمْ يَتَذَكَّرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	We	indeed	gave	Moosa	the	Book	after	We	had	destroyed	the	former	generations,	having	
enlightenment	for	mankind,	and	a	guidance	and	a	mercy,	for	them	to	accept	advice.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	be-shak	ham	ne	Mūsā	ko	Kitāb	‘aṭā	farmāi	b’ad	is	ke	ke	agli	sangteñ	(qaumeñ)	halāk	farmā	
diñ		jis	meiñ	logon	ke	dil	ki	āankheñ	kholne	wāli	bāteñ	aur	hidāyat	aur	raḥmat	take	woh	nasiḥat	
māneñ.

arabicText: وَمَا كُنتَ بِجَانِبِ ٱلْغَرْبِىِّ إِذْ قَضَيْنَآ إِلَىٰ مُوسَى ٱلْأَمْرَ وَمَا كُنتَ مِنَ ٱلشَّـٰهِدِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	you	(O	dear	Prophet	Muhammad	-	
peace	and	blessings	be	upon	him)	were	not	
on	the	western	side	of	the	Mount	when	We	
sent	the	command	of	Prophethood	to	
Moosa,	and	you	were	not	present.	(Yet	you	
narrate	the	account	very	clearly	to	the	Jews	
and	Christians.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	tum	Ṭoor	ki	jānib-e-maghrib	meiñ	na	
the	jab	ke	ham	ne	Mūsā	ko	risālt	kā	ḥukm	
bhejā	aur	us	waqt	tum	ḥazir	na	the.

arabicText: وَلَـٰكِنَّآ أَنشَأْنَا قُرُونًۭا فَتَطَاوَلَ عَلَيْهِمُ ٱلْعُمُرُ ۚ وَمَا كُنتَ ثَاوِيًۭا فِىٓ أَهْلِ مَدْيَنَ تَتْلُوا۟ عَلَيْهِمْ ءَايَـٰتِنَا وَلَـٰكِنَّا كُنَّا مُرْسِلِينَ
englishTranslationText:
However,	We	created	generations	and	
ages	passed	by	upon	them;	and	nor	were	
you	dwelling	with	the	people	of	Madyan	
reciting	Our	verses	to	them	–	however	it	is	
We	Who	made	the	Noble	Messengers.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Magar	huā	ye	ke	ham	ne	sangateñ	paidā	
kiñ	ke	un	par	zamāna	darāz	guzrā	aur	na	
tum	Ahl-e-Madyan	meiñ	muqeem	the	un	
par	hamāri	Āayateñ	padhte	huwe	hāñ	ham	
Rasool	banane	wāle	huwe

arabicText: وَمَا كُنتَ بِجَانِبِ ٱلطُّورِ إِذْ نَادَيْنَا وَلَـٰكِن رَّحْمَةًۭ مِّن رَّبِّكَ لِتُنذِرَ قَوْمًۭا مَّآ أَتَىٰهُم مِّن نَّذِيرٍۢ مِّن قَبْلِكَ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَتَذَكَّرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	nor	were	you	beside	the	Mount	when	
We	proclaimed	–	however	it	is	a	mercy	
from	your	Lord*	so	that	you	may	warn	a	
nation	towards	whom	no	Herald	of	
Warning	came	before	you,	in	the	hope	of	
their	heeding	advice.	(*That	He	has	
bestowed	knowledge	of	the	hidden	to	you)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	na	tum	Ṭoor	ke	kināre	the	jab	ham	ne	
nidā	farmāi	hāñ	tumhāre	Rab	ki	mehar	hai	
(ke	tumheñ	ghaib	ke	‘ilm	diye)	ke	tum	aisi	
qaun	ko	dar	sunāō	jis	ke	pās	tum	se	pahle	
koi	dar	sunāne	wālā	na	āayā	ye	ummid	
karte	huye	ke	un	ko	nasiḥat	ho.

arabicText: وَلَوْلَآ أَن تُصِيبَهُم مُّصِيبَةٌۢ بِمَا قَدَّمَتْ أَيْدِيهِمْ فَيَقُولُوا۟ رَبَّنَا لَوْلَآ أَرْسَلْتَ إِلَيْنَا رَسُولًۭا فَنَتَّبِعَ ءَايَـٰتِكَ وَنَكُونَ مِنَ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
englishTranslationText:
Otherwise,	if	some	disaster	befell	them	
because	of	what	their	own	hands	have	sent	
forward	they	would	say,	“Our	Lord!	Why	
did	you	not	send	a	Noble	Messenger	
towards	us,	so	we	may	have	followed	Your	
signs	and	accepted	faith?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	agar	na	hotā	ke	kabhi	pahuñchti	unheñ	
koi	musibat	us	ke	sabab	jo	un	ke	hāthoñ	ne	
āage	bhejā		to	kahte	aey	hamāre	Rab	tu	ne	
kyuñ	na	bhejā	hamāri	ṭaraf	koi	Rasool	ke	
ham	teri	āayatoñ	ki	pairwi	karte	aur	imān	
late.

arabicText: فَلَمَّا جَآءَهُمُ ٱلْحَقُّ مِنْ عِندِنَا قَالُوا۟ لَوْلَآ أُوتِىَ مِثْلَ مَآ أُوتِىَ مُوسَىٰٓ ۚ أَوَلَمْ يَكْفُرُوا۟ بِمَآ أُوتِىَ مُوسَىٰ مِن قَبْلُ ۖ قَالُوا۟ سِحْرَانِ تَظَـٰهَرَا وَقَالُوٓا۟ إِنَّا بِكُلٍّۢ كَـٰفِرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
So	when	the	Truth	*	from	Us	came	to	them,	
they	said,	“Why	has	he	not	been	given	what	
was	given	to	Moosa?”	Had	they	not	disbelieved	in	what	was	earlier	given	to	Moosa?	They	said,	
“They	are	two	magicians,	who	support	each	other”;	and	said,	“We	disbelieve	in	both	of	them.”	(*	
Prophet	Muhammad	–	peace	and	blessings	be	upon	him).
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	jab	un	ke	pās	ḥaq	āayā	hamāri	ṭaraf	se	
bole	inheñ	kyoñ	na	diyā	gayā	jo	Mūsā	ko	
diyā	gayā	kyā	us	ke	munkir	na	huye	the	jo	
pahle	Mūsā	ko	diyā	gayā	bole	do	jādu	haiñ	aik	dosre	ki	Pushti	(imdād)	par	aur	bole	ham	in	donoñ	
ke	munkir	haiñ.

arabicText: قُلْ فَأْتُوا۟ بِكِتَـٰبٍۢ مِّنْ عِندِ ٱللَّهِ هُوَ أَهْدَىٰ مِنْهُمَآ أَتَّبِعْهُ إِن كُنتُمْ صَـٰدِقِينَ
englishTranslationText:
Proclaim	(O	dear	Prophet	Muhammad	-	peace	and	blessings	be	upon	him),	“Therefore	bring	a	Book	
from	Allah	which	is	better	guiding	than	these	two	-	I	will	follow	it	-	if	you	are	truthful.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tum	farmāō	to	Allāh	ke	pās	se	koi	Kitāb	le	āaō	jo	in	donoñ	Kitāboñ	se	ziyāda	hidāyat	ki	ho	maiñ	
us	ki	pairwi	karoñ	ga	agar	tum	sachche	ho.

arabicText: فَإِن لَّمْ يَسْتَجِيبُوا۟ لَكَ فَٱعْلَمْ أَنَّمَا يَتَّبِعُونَ أَهْوَآءَهُمْ ۚ وَمَنْ أَضَلُّ مِمَّنِ ٱتَّبَعَ هَوَىٰهُ بِغَيْرِ هُدًۭى مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَا يَهْدِى ٱلْقَوْمَ ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
So	if	they	do	not	accept	your	challenge,	then	know	that	they	only	follow	their	desires;	and	who	is	
more	astray	than	one	who	follows	his	desires	away	from	the	guidance	of	Allah?	Indeed	Allah	does	
not	guide	the	unjust.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	agar	wo	ye	tumhārā	farmānā	qubol	na	kareñ	to	jān	lo	ke	bas	wo	apni	khwahishoñ	hi	ke	piche	
haiñ	aur	us	se	badh	kar	gumrāh	kaun	jo	apni	khwahish	ki	pairwi	kare	Allāh	ki	hidāyat	se	judā	be
shak	Allāh	hidāyat	nahiñ	farmāta	zālim	logoñ	ko.

arabicText: ۞ وَلَقَدْ وَصَّلْنَا لَهُمُ ٱلْقَوْلَ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَتَذَكَّرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	We	indeed	sent	down	the	Word	
continuously	for	them,	so	that	they	may	
ponder.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	be-shak	Ham	ne	un	ke	liye	bāt	
musalsal	utāri	ke	woh	dhiyān	kareñ.

arabicText: ٱلَّذِينَ ءَاتَيْنَـٰهُمُ ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ مِن قَبْلِهِۦ هُم بِهِۦ يُؤْمِنُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Those	to	whom	We	gave	the	Book	before	
it,	accept	faith	in	it.	(Some	scholars	among	
Jews	/	Christians).
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jin	ko	ham	ne	is	se	pahle	Kitāb	di	woh	us	
par	Imān	lāte	haiñ.

arabicText: وَإِذَا يُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْهِمْ قَالُوٓا۟ ءَامَنَّا بِهِۦٓ إِنَّهُ ٱلْحَقُّ مِن رَّبِّنَآ إِنَّا كُنَّا مِن قَبْلِهِۦ مُسْلِمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	when	these	verses	are	recited	to	them,	
they	say,	“We	believe	in	it	-	indeed	it	is	the	
Truth	from	our	Lord	–	and	indeed	we	had	
accepted	even	before	this.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jab	un	par	ye	āayateñ	padhi	jāti	haiñ	
kahte	haiñ	ham	is	par	Imān	lāye	be-shak	
yahi	ḥaq	hai	hamāre	Rab	ke	pās	se	ham	is	
se	pahle	hi	garden	rakh	chuke	haiñ.

arabicText: أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ يُؤْتَوْنَ أَجْرَهُم مَّرَّتَيْنِ بِمَا صَبَرُوا۟ وَيَدْرَءُونَ بِٱلْحَسَنَةِ ٱلسَّيِّئَةَ وَمِمَّا رَزَقْنَـٰهُمْ يُنفِقُونَ
englishTranslationText:
They	will	be	given	double	the	reward,	the	
recompense	of	their	patience	–	and	they	
repel	evil	with	good,	and	spend	part	of	
what	We	have	provided	them.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Un	ko	un	kā	ajr	do-bālā	diyā	jāye	ga	badla	
un	ke	sabr	kā	aur	woh	bhalāi	se	burāi	ko	
tālte	haiñ	aur	hamāre	diye	se	kuch	hamāri	
rāh	meiñ	kharch	karte	haiñ.

arabicText: وَإِذَا سَمِعُوا۟ ٱللَّغْوَ أَعْرَضُوا۟ عَنْهُ وَقَالُوا۟ لَنَآ أَعْمَـٰلُنَا وَلَكُمْ أَعْمَـٰلُكُمْ سَلَـٰمٌ عَلَيْكُمْ لَا نَبْتَغِى ٱلْجَـٰهِلِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	when	they	hear	indecent	speech,	they	
ignore	it	and	say,	“For	us	are	our	deeds	and	
for	you	are	your	deeds;	peace	be	upon	you	
(good	bye);	we	are	not	interested	in	the	
ignorant.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jab	be-hooda	bāt	sunte	haiñ	us	se	
taghāful	karte	haiñ	aur	kahte	haiñ	hamāre	
liye	hamāre	‘amal	aur	tumhāre	liye	
tumhāre	‘amal	bas	tum	par	salām	ham	
jāhiloñ	ke	gharzi	(chāhne	wāle)	nahiñ.

arabicText: إِنَّكَ لَا تَهْدِى مَنْ أَحْبَبْتَ وَلَـٰكِنَّ ٱللَّهَ يَهْدِى مَن يَشَآءُ ۚ وَهُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِٱلْمُهْتَدِينَ
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	it	is	not	such	that	you	can	guide	
whomever	you	love,	but	Allah	guides	
whomever	He	wills;	and	He	well	knows	the	
people	upon	guidance.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	ye	nahiñ	ke	tum	jise	apni	ṭaraf	se	
chāho	hidāyat	kar	do	hān	Allāh	hidāyat	
farmātā	hai	jise	chāhe	aur	woh	khob	jāntā	
hai	hidāyat	wāloñ	ko.

arabicText: وَقَالُوٓا۟ إِن نَّتَّبِعِ ٱلْهُدَىٰ مَعَكَ نُتَخَطَّفْ مِنْ أَرْضِنَآ ۚ أَوَلَمْ نُمَكِّن لَّهُمْ حَرَمًا ءَامِنًۭا يُجْبَىٰٓ إِلَيْهِ ثَمَرَٰتُ كُلِّ شَىْءٍۢ رِّزْقًۭا مِّن لَّدُنَّا وَلَـٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَهُمْ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	they	say,	“If	we	follow	the	guidance	
along	with	you,	people	would	snatch	us	
away	from	our	land”;	did	We	not	establish	
them	in	a	safe	Sacred	Land,	towards	which	are	brought	fruits	of	all	kinds	–	the	sustenance	from	
Us?	But	most	of	them	do	not	know.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	kahte	haiñ	agar	ham	tumhāre	sāth	
hidāyat	ki	pairwi	kareñ	to	log	hamāre	mulk	
se	hameñ	uchak	le	jāyeñ	ge	kyā	ham	ne	unheñ	jagah	na	di	amān	wāli	ḥaram	meiñ	jis	ki	ṭaraf	har	
chiz	ke	phal	lāye	jāte	haiñ	hamāre	pās	ki	rozi	lekin	un	meiñ	aksar	ko	‘ilm	nahiñ.

arabicText: وَكَمْ أَهْلَكْنَا مِن قَرْيَةٍۭ بَطِرَتْ مَعِيشَتَهَا ۖ فَتِلْكَ مَسَـٰكِنُهُمْ لَمْ تُسْكَن مِّنۢ بَعْدِهِمْ إِلَّا قَلِيلًۭا ۖ وَكُنَّا نَحْنُ ٱلْوَٰرِثِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	how	many	towns	did	We	destroy	which	had	stooped	to	self	indulgence!	So	here	lie	their	
dwellings,	uninhabited	after	them	except	a	little;	and	only	We	are	the	Inheritors.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	kitne	shahar	ham	ne	halāk	kar	diye	jo	apne	‘aish	par	itrā	gaye	the	to	ye	haiñ	un	ke	makān	ke	
un	ke	b’ad	in	meiñ	sukunat	na	hui	magar	kam	aur	hamiñ	wāris	haiñ.

arabicText: وَمَا كَانَ رَبُّكَ مُهْلِكَ ٱلْقُرَىٰ حَتَّىٰ يَبْعَثَ فِىٓ أُمِّهَا رَسُولًۭا يَتْلُوا۟ عَلَيْهِمْ ءَايَـٰتِنَا ۚ وَمَا كُنَّا مُهْلِكِى ٱلْقُرَىٰٓ إِلَّا وَأَهْلُهَا ظَـٰلِمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	never	does	your	Lord	destroy	towns	until	He	sends	a	Noble	Messenger	to	their	principal	
town,	reciting	Our	verses	to	them;	and	We	never	destroy	towns	unless	its	people	are	unjust.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	tumhārā	Rab	shahroñ	ko	halāk	nahiñ	kartā	jab	tak	un	ke	asl	marja’a	meiñ	Rasool	na	bheje	jo	
un	par	hamāri	Āayateñ	padhe	aur	ham	shahroñ	ko	halāk	nahiñ	karte	magar	jab	ke	un	ke	sākin	
sitam-gār	hoñ.

arabicText: وَمَآ أُوتِيتُم مِّن شَىْءٍۢ فَمَتَـٰعُ ٱلْحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنْيَا وَزِينَتُهَا ۚ وَمَا عِندَ ٱللَّهِ خَيْرٌۭ وَأَبْقَىٰٓ ۚ أَفَلَا تَعْقِلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	whatever	you	have	been	given,	is	a	
usage	in	the	life	of	this	world	and	its	
adornment;	and	that	which	is	with	Allah	is	
better	and	more	lasting;	so	do	you	not	have	
sense?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jo	kuch	chiz	tumheñ	di	gayi	hai	woh	
dunyawi	zindagi	kā	bartāwā	aur	us	kā	
singār	hai	aur	jo	Allāh	ke	pās	haiwoh	
bahtar	aur	ziyāda	bāqi	rahne	wālā	to	kyā	
tumheñ	‘aql	nahiñ.

arabicText: أَفَمَن وَعَدْنَـٰهُ وَعْدًا حَسَنًۭا فَهُوَ لَـٰقِيهِ كَمَن مَّتَّعْنَـٰهُ مَتَـٰعَ ٱلْحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنْيَا ثُمَّ هُوَ يَوْمَ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ مِنَ ٱلْمُحْضَرِينَ
englishTranslationText:
So	is	he	whom	We	have	given	a	good	
promise	-	he	will	therefore	get	it	-	equal	to	
him	whom	We	gave	the	usage	of	the	life	of	
this	world	to	enjoy,	and	who	will	then	be	
brought	captive	on	the	Day	of	
Resurrection?
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	kyā	woh	jise	ham	ne	achchā	w’ada	diyā	
to	woh	us	se	mile	ga	us	jisa	hai	jise	ham	ne	
dunyawi	zindagi	kā	bartāō	baratne	diyā	
phir	woh	qayāmat	ke	din	giriftār	kar	ke	
ḥazir	lāyā	jāye	ga.

arabicText: وَيَوْمَ يُنَادِيهِمْ فَيَقُولُ أَيْنَ شُرَكَآءِىَ ٱلَّذِينَ كُنتُمْ تَزْعُمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
On	the	day	when	He	will	call	to	them	–	He	
will	therefore	proclaim,	“Where	are	those	
partners	of	Mine,	whom	you	had	
assumed?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jis	din	unheñ	nidā	karega	to	farmāye	
ga	kahañ	haiñ	mere	woh	sharik	jinheñ	tum	
gumān	karte	the.

arabicText: قَالَ ٱلَّذِينَ حَقَّ عَلَيْهِمُ ٱلْقَوْلُ رَبَّنَا هَـٰٓؤُلَآءِ ٱلَّذِينَ أَغْوَيْنَآ أَغْوَيْنَـٰهُمْ كَمَا غَوَيْنَا ۖ تَبَرَّأْنَآ إِلَيْكَ ۖ مَا كَانُوٓا۟ إِيَّانَا يَعْبُدُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Those	against	whom	the	Word	will	have	
proved	true	will	say,	“Our	Lord!	It	is	these	
whom	we	led	astray;	we	led	them	astray	
the	way	we	ourselves	went	astray;	we	are	
unconcerned	with	them	and	we	incline	
towards	You	-	they	never	worshipped	us!”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kaheñ	ge	woh	jin	par	bāt	sābit	ho	chuki	aey	
hamāre	Rab	ye	haiñ	woh	jinheñ	ham	ne	
gumrāh	kiyā	ham	ne	unheñ	gumrāh	kyā	
jaise	khud	gumrāh	huye	the	ham	un	se	
bezār	ho	kar	teri	ṭaraf	ruju’u	late	haiñ	woh	
ham	ko	na	poojte	the.

arabicText: وَقِيلَ ٱدْعُوا۟ شُرَكَآءَكُمْ فَدَعَوْهُمْ فَلَمْ يَسْتَجِيبُوا۟ لَهُمْ وَرَأَوُا۟ ٱلْعَذَابَ ۚ لَوْ أَنَّهُمْ كَانُوا۟ يَهْتَدُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	it	will	be	said	to	them,	“Call	unto	your	
ascribed	partners”	–	so	they	will	call	unto	
them	and	they	will	not	listen	to	them,	and	
they	will	behold	the	punishment;	if	only	
they	had	obtained	guidance!
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	un	se	farmāyā	jāyega	ke	apne	sharikoñ	
ko	pukāro	to	woh	pukāreñ	ge	to	woh	un	ki	
na	suneñ	ge	aur	dekheñ	ge	‘aƶāb	kyā	
achchā	hotā	agar	woh	rāh	pāte.

arabicText: وَيَوْمَ يُنَادِيهِمْ فَيَقُولُ مَاذَآ أَجَبْتُمُ ٱلْمُرْسَلِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	the	Day	He	will	call	them	and	
proclaim,	“What	answer	did	you	give	to	the	
Noble	Messengers?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jis	din	unheñ	nidā	karegā	to	farmāye	
ga	tum	ne	Rasoloñ	ko	kyā	jawāb	diyā.

arabicText: فَعَمِيَتْ عَلَيْهِمُ ٱلْأَنۢبَآءُ يَوْمَئِذٍۢ فَهُمْ لَا يَتَسَآءَلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
So	on	that	Day	the	tidings	will	be	blinded	*	
for	them,	therefore	they	will	not	ask	one	another.	(*	They	will	forget	at	that	moment).
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	us	din	un	par	khabreñ	andhi	ho	jāyeñ	gi	
to	woh	kuch	pooch	gach	na	kareñ	ge.

arabicText: فَأَمَّا مَن تَابَ وَءَامَنَ وَعَمِلَ صَـٰلِحًۭا فَعَسَىٰٓ أَن يَكُونَ مِنَ ٱلْمُفْلِحِينَ
englishTranslationText:
So	whoever	repented	and	accepted	faith	and	did	good	deeds,	so	it	is	likely	that	he	will	be	among	
the	successful.
romanUrduTranslationText: To	woh	jis	ne	tuabā	ki	aur	Imān	lāyā	aur	achchā	kām	kyā	qarib	hai	ke	woh	rāh	yāb	ho.

arabicText: وَرَبُّكَ يَخْلُقُ مَا يَشَآءُ وَيَخْتَارُ ۗ مَا كَانَ لَهُمُ ٱلْخِيَرَةُ ۚ سُبْحَـٰنَ ٱللَّهِ وَتَعَـٰلَىٰ عَمَّا يُشْرِكُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	your	Lord	creates	whatever	He	wills,	and	chooses;	they	do	not	have	any	power	to	choose;	
Purity	and	Supremacy	are	to	Allah	above	their	ascribing	partners	(to	Him).
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	tumhārā	Rab	paidā	kartā	hai	jo	chāhe	aur	pasand	farmātāt	hai	in	kā	kuch	ikhtiyār	nahiñ	pāki	
aur	bartari	hai	Allāh	ko	un	ke	shirk	se.

arabicText: وَرَبُّكَ يَعْلَمُ مَا تُكِنُّ صُدُورُهُمْ وَمَا يُعْلِنُونَ
englishTranslationText: And	your	Lord	knows	what	is	hidden	in	their	breasts,	and	what	they	disclose.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	tumhārā	Rab	jāntā	hai	jo	un	ke	sinoñ	meiñ	chipā	hai	aur	jo	zāhir	karte	haiñ.

arabicText: وَهُوَ ٱللَّهُ لَآ إِلَـٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ ۖ لَهُ ٱلْحَمْدُ فِى ٱلْأُولَىٰ وَٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ ۖ وَلَهُ ٱلْحُكْمُ وَإِلَيْهِ تُرْجَعُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	He	is	Allah	-	there	is	no	God	except	Him;	only	His	is	the	praise	in	this	world	and	in	the	
Hereafter;	and	only	His	is	the	command,	and	it	is	towards	Him	that	you	will	be	returned.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	wohi	hai	Allāh	ke	koi	khudā	nahiñ	us	ke	siwā	usi	ki	t’arif	hai	dunyā	aur	āakhirat	meiñ	aur	usi	
kā	ḥukm	hai	aur	usi	ki	ṭaraf	phir	jāō	ge.

arabicText: قُلْ أَرَءَيْتُمْ إِن جَعَلَ ٱللَّهُ عَلَيْكُمُ ٱلَّيْلَ سَرْمَدًا إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ مَنْ إِلَـٰهٌ غَيْرُ ٱللَّهِ يَأْتِيكُم بِضِيَآءٍ ۖ أَفَلَا تَسْمَعُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Proclaim,	“What	is	your	opinion	-	if	Allah	
makes	it	night	continuously	for	you	till	the	
Day	of	Resurrection	then,	other	than	Allah,	
who	is	the	God	who	could	bring	you	light?	
So	do	you	not	heed?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tum	farmāō	bhalā	dekho	to	agar	Allāh	
hamesha	tum	par	Qiyāmat	tak	rāt	rakhe	to	
Allāh	ke	siwā	kaun	khudā	hai	jo	tumheñ	
roshni	lā	de	to	kyā	tum	sunte	nahiñ?

arabicText: قُلْ أَرَءَيْتُمْ إِن جَعَلَ ٱللَّهُ عَلَيْكُمُ ٱلنَّهَارَ سَرْمَدًا إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ مَنْ إِلَـٰهٌ غَيْرُ ٱللَّهِ يَأْتِيكُم بِلَيْلٍۢ تَسْكُنُونَ فِيهِ ۖ أَفَلَا تُبْصِرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Say,	“What	is	your	opinion	-	if	Allah	makes	
it	day	continuously	for	you	till	the	Day	of	
Resurrection	then,	other	than	Allah,	who	is	
the	God	who	could	bring	you	night	for	you	
to	rest	during	it?	So	do	you	not	perceive?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tum	farmāō	bhalā	dekho	to	agar	Allāh	
hamesha	tum	par	qayāmat	tak	din	rakhe	to	
Allāh	ke	siwā	kaun	khudā	hai	jo	tumheñ	rāt	
lā	de	jis	meiñ	āarām	karo	to	kyā	tumheñ	
soojhtā	nahiñ.

arabicText: وَمِن رَّحْمَتِهِۦ جَعَلَ لَكُمُ ٱلَّيْلَ وَٱلنَّهَارَ لِتَسْكُنُوا۟ فِيهِ وَلِتَبْتَغُوا۟ مِن فَضْلِهِۦ وَلَعَلَّكُمْ تَشْكُرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	with	His	mercy	He	made	the	night	and	
day	for	you,	so	that	you	may	rest	during	
the	night	and	seek	His	munificence	during	
the	day,	and	for	you	to	be	thankful.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Us	ne	apni	Maher	(Raḥmat)	se	
tumhāre	liye	rāt	aur	din	banāye	ke	rāt	
meiñ	āarām	karo	aur	din	meiñ	us	kā	fazl	
dhondo	aur	is	liye	ke	tum	ḥaq	māno.

arabicText: وَيَوْمَ يُنَادِيهِمْ فَيَقُولُ أَيْنَ شُرَكَآءِىَ ٱلَّذِينَ كُنتُمْ تَزْعُمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	the	Day	He	will	call	them	–	He	will	
therefore	proclaim,	“Where	are	those	
partners	of	Mine,	whom	you	had	
assumed?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jis	din	unheñ	nidā	kare	ga	to	farmāye	
ga	kahañ	haiñ	mere	woh	sharik	jo	tum	
bakte	the

arabicText: وَنَزَعْنَا مِن كُلِّ أُمَّةٍۢ شَهِيدًۭا فَقُلْنَا هَاتُوا۟ بُرْهَـٰنَكُمْ فَعَلِمُوٓا۟ أَنَّ ٱلْحَقَّ لِلَّهِ وَضَلَّ عَنْهُم مَّا كَانُوا۟ يَفْتَرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	We	shall	proclaim	taking	out	a	witness	
from	each	group,	“Bring	your	proof”	–	so	
they	will	realise	that	the	Truth	(Right)	is	
for	Allah,	and	they	will	lose	all	that	they	
had	fabricated.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	har	giroh	meiñ	se	ham	aik	gwāh	nikāl	
kar	farmāyeñ	ge	apni	dalil	lāō	to	jān	leñge	
ke	ḥaq	Allāh	kā	hai	aur	un	se	khoi	jāyeñ	gi	jo	banāwateñ	karte	the.

arabicText: ۞ إِنَّ قَـٰرُونَ كَانَ مِن قَوْمِ مُوسَىٰ فَبَغَىٰ عَلَيْهِمْ ۖ وَءَاتَيْنَـٰهُ مِنَ ٱلْكُنُوزِ مَآ إِنَّ مَفَاتِحَهُۥ لَتَنُوٓأُ بِٱلْعُصْبَةِ أُو۟لِى ٱلْقُوَّةِ إِذْ قَالَ لَهُۥ قَوْمُهُۥ لَا تَفْرَحْ ۖ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَا يُحِبُّ ٱلْفَرِحِينَ
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	Qaroon	was	from	the	people	of	
Moosa	-	he	then	oppressed	them;	and	We	
gave	him	so	many	treasures	that	their	keys	
were	a	heavy	burden	for	a	strong	group;	
when	his	people	said	to	him,	“Do	not	show	off	-	indeed	Allah	does	not	like	the	boastful.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	Qāroon	Mūsā	ki	qaum	se	thā	phir	us	ne	un	par	ziyādati	ki	aur	ham	ne	us	ko	itne	khazāne	
diye	jin	ki	kunjiyāñ	aik	zor	āawar	jamā’at	par	bhāri	thiñ	jab	us	se	us	ki	qaum	ne	kahā	itrā	nahiñ	
be-shak	Allāh	itrāne	wāloñ	ko	dost	nahiñ	rakhtā.

arabicText: وَٱبْتَغِ فِيمَآ ءَاتَىٰكَ ٱللَّهُ ٱلدَّارَ ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةَ ۖ وَلَا تَنسَ نَصِيبَكَ مِنَ ٱلدُّنْيَا ۖ وَأَحْسِن كَمَآ أَحْسَنَ ٱللَّهُ إِلَيْكَ ۖ وَلَا تَبْغِ ٱلْفَسَادَ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ ۖ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَا يُحِبُّ ٱلْمُفْسِدِينَ
englishTranslationText:
“And	seek	the	abode	of	the	Hereafter	with	the	wealth	that	Allah	has	given	you,	and	do	not	forget	
your	part	in	this	world,	and	do	favours	(to	others)	the	way	Allah	has	favoured	you,	and	do	not	
seek	to	cause	turmoil	in	the	earth;	indeed	Allah	does	not	like	the	mischievous.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jo	māl	tujhe	Allāh	ne	diyā	hai	us	se	āakhirat	kā	ghar	ṭalab	kar	aur	dunyā	meiñ	apnā	ḥissa	na	
bhool	aur	iḥsān	kar	jaisā	Allāh	ne	tujh	par	iḥsān	kyā	aur	zameen	meiñ	fasād	na	chāh	be-shak	Allāh	
fasādiyoñ	ko	dost	nahiñ	rakhtā.

arabicText: قَالَ إِنَّمَآ أُوتِيتُهُۥ عَلَىٰ عِلْمٍ عِندِىٓ ۚ أَوَلَمْ يَعْلَمْ أَنَّ ٱللَّهَ قَدْ أَهْلَكَ مِن قَبْلِهِۦ مِنَ ٱلْقُرُونِ مَنْ هُوَ أَشَدُّ مِنْهُ قُوَّةًۭ وَأَكْثَرُ جَمْعًۭا ۚ وَلَا يُسْـَٔلُ عَن ذُنُوبِهِمُ ٱلْمُجْرِمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
He	said,	“I	got	this	only	due	to	a	knowledge	
I	have”;	and	does	he	not	know	that	before	
him	Allah	destroyed	the	generations	who	
were	stronger	than	him	and	more	in	
number?	And	there	is	no	questioning	of	the	
guilty	regarding	their	sins.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Bola	ye	to	mujhe	aik	ílm	se	milā	hai	jo	mere	
pās	hai	aur	kyā	use	ye	nahiñ	m’alom	ke	
Allāh	ne	is	se	pahle	woh	
sangateñ(qaumeñ)	halāk	farmā	diñ	jinki	
quwwateñ	is	se	sakht	thiñ	aur	jam’a	us	se	
ziyāda	aur	mujrimoñ	se	un	ke	gunāhoñ	ki	
pooch	nahiñ.

arabicText: فَخَرَجَ عَلَىٰ قَوْمِهِۦ فِى زِينَتِهِۦ ۖ قَالَ ٱلَّذِينَ يُرِيدُونَ ٱلْحَيَوٰةَ ٱلدُّنْيَا يَـٰلَيْتَ لَنَا مِثْلَ مَآ أُوتِىَ قَـٰرُونُ إِنَّهُۥ لَذُو حَظٍّ عَظِيمٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
He	therefore	came	before	his	people	in	his	
pomp;	said	those	who	desired	the	worldly	
life,	“If	only	we	were	to	get	what	Qaroon	
has	been	given	-	he	is	indeed	very	
fortunate.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	apni	qaum	par	niklā	apni	āarāish	meiñ	
bole	woh	jo	dunyā	ki	zindagi	chāhte	haiñ	
kisi	ṭaraḥ	ham	ko	bhi	aisā	miltā	jaisā	qāron	
ko	milā	be-shak	us	kā	badā	nasib	hai.

arabicText: وَقَالَ ٱلَّذِينَ أُوتُوا۟ ٱلْعِلْمَ وَيْلَكُمْ ثَوَابُ ٱللَّهِ خَيْرٌۭ لِّمَنْ ءَامَنَ وَعَمِلَ صَـٰلِحًۭا وَلَا يُلَقَّىٰهَآ إِلَّا ٱلصَّـٰبِرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	said	those	who	were	given	the	
knowledge,	“Woe	to	you	-	the	reward	of	
Allah	is	better	for	one	who	accepts	faith	
and	does	good	deeds;	and	only	those	who	
are	patient	will	receive	it.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	bole	woh	jinheñ	‘ilm	diyā	gayā	kharābi	
ho	tumhāri	Allāh	kā	sawāb	bahtar	hai	us	ke	
liye	jo	Imān	lāye	aur	achche	kām	kare	aur	
ye	unhiñ	ko	miltā	hai	jo	sabr	wāle	haiñ.

arabicText: فَخَسَفْنَا بِهِۦ وَبِدَارِهِ ٱلْأَرْضَ فَمَا كَانَ لَهُۥ مِن فِئَةٍۢ يَنصُرُونَهُۥ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ وَمَا كَانَ مِنَ ٱلْمُنتَصِرِينَ
englishTranslationText:
We	therefore	buried	him	and	his	house	
into	the	earth;	so	he	had	no	group	to	help	
save	him	from	Allah;	nor	could	he	take	
revenge.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	ham	ne	use	aur	us	ke	ghar	ko	zameen	
meiñ	dhansā	diyā	to	us	ke	pās	koi	jamā’at	
na	thi	ke	Allāh	se	bachāne	meiñ	us	ki	
madad	karti	aur	na	woh	badla	le	sakā.

arabicText: وَأَصْبَحَ ٱلَّذِينَ تَمَنَّوْا۟ مَكَانَهُۥ بِٱلْأَمْسِ يَقُولُونَ وَيْكَأَنَّ ٱللَّهَ يَبْسُطُ ٱلرِّزْقَ لِمَن يَشَآءُ مِنْ عِبَادِهِۦ وَيَقْدِرُ ۖ لَوْلَآ أَن مَّنَّ ٱللَّهُ عَلَيْنَا لَخَسَفَ بِنَا ۖ وَيْكَأَنَّهُۥ لَا يُفْلِحُ ٱلْكَـٰفِرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	those	who	had	the	day	before	desired	
his	status,	said	in	the	morning,	“It	is	
strange	-	Allah	expands	the	sustenance	for	
whomever	He	wills	among	His	bondmen,	
and	restricts	it;	if	Allah	had	not	been	
gracious	to	us	He	would	have	buried	us	
too;	strangely,	the	disbelievers	do	not	
prosper.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	kal	jis	ne	us	ke	martabe	ki	āarzo	ki	thi	
subaḥ	kahne	lage	‘ajab	bāt	hai	Allāh	rizq	
wasi’a	kartā	hai	apne	bandoñ	meiñ	jis	ke	
liye	chāhe	aur	tangi	farmātā	hai	agar	Allāh	ham	par	iḥsān	na	farmātā	to	hameñ	bhi	dhansā	detā	
aey	‘ajab	kāfiroñ	ka	bhalā	nahiñ.

arabicText: تِلْكَ ٱلدَّارُ ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةُ نَجْعَلُهَا لِلَّذِينَ لَا يُرِيدُونَ عُلُوًّۭا فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَلَا فَسَادًۭا ۚ وَٱلْعَـٰقِبَةُ لِلْمُتَّقِينَ
englishTranslationText:
This	abode	of	the	Hereafter	-	We	make	it	for	those	who	do	not	wish	greatness	in	the	land	nor	
turmoil;	and	the	Hereafter	is	only	for	the	pious.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Ye	āakhirat	kā	ghar	ham	un	ke	liye	karte	haiñ	jo	zameen	meiñ	takabbur	nahiñ	chāhte	aur	na	fasād	
aur	‘aāqibat	parhezgāroñ	hi	ki	hai.

arabicText: مَن جَآءَ بِٱلْحَسَنَةِ فَلَهُۥ خَيْرٌۭ مِّنْهَا ۖ وَمَن جَآءَ بِٱلسَّيِّئَةِ فَلَا يُجْزَى ٱلَّذِينَ عَمِلُوا۟ ٱلسَّيِّـَٔاتِ إِلَّا مَا كَانُوا۟ يَعْمَلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Whoever	brings	virtue,	for	him	is	better	than	it;	and	whoever	brings	evil	–	so	those	who	commit	
evil	will	not	be	repaid	except	to	the	extent	of	their	deeds.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jo	neki	lāye	us	ke	liye	us	se	bahtar	hai	aur	jo	badi	lāye	to	bad	kām	wāloñ	ko	badla	na	mile	ga	
magar	jitnā	kyā	thā.

arabicText: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِى فَرَضَ عَلَيْكَ ٱلْقُرْءَانَ لَرَآدُّكَ إِلَىٰ مَعَادٍۢ ۚ قُل رَّبِّىٓ أَعْلَمُ مَن جَآءَ بِٱلْهُدَىٰ وَمَنْ هُوَ فِى ضَلَـٰلٍۢ مُّبِينٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	He	Who	has	ordained	the	Qur’an	
upon	you,	will	surely	bring	you	back	to	
where	you	wish;	proclaim,	“My	Lord	well	
knows	him	who	came	with	guidance,	and	
him	who	is	in	open	error.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	jis	ne	tum	par	qur’ān	farz	kiyā	
woh	tumheñ	pher	le	jāye	ga	jahāñ	phirnā	
chāhte	ho	tum	farmāō	merā	Rab	khob	
jāntā	hai	use	jo	hidāyat	lāyā	aur	jo	khuli	
gumrāhi	meiñ	hai.

arabicText: وَمَا كُنتَ تَرْجُوٓا۟ أَن يُلْقَىٰٓ إِلَيْكَ ٱلْكِتَـٰبُ إِلَّا رَحْمَةًۭ مِّن رَّبِّكَ ۖ فَلَا تَكُونَنَّ ظَهِيرًۭا لِّلْكَـٰفِرِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	you	held	no	expectations	of	the	Book	
being	sent	down	upon	you,	except	that	it	is	
a	mercy	from	your	Lord	-	therefore	never	
support	the	disbelievers.	(You	did	not	crave	
for	it	but	trusted	in	the	mercy	of	your	Lord).
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	tum	ummid	na	rakhte	the	ke	Kitāb	tum	
par	bheji	jāye	gi	hāñ	tumhāre	Rab	ne	
raḥmat	farmāi	to	tum	hargiz	kāfiroñ	ki	
pushti(madad)	na	karnā.

arabicText: وَلَا يَصُدُّنَّكَ عَنْ ءَايَـٰتِ ٱللَّهِ بَعْدَ إِذْ أُنزِلَتْ إِلَيْكَ ۖ وَٱدْعُ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ ۖ وَلَا تَكُونَنَّ مِنَ ٱلْمُشْرِكِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	never	may	they	prevent	you	from	the	
verses	of	Allah	after	they	have	been	sent	
down	upon	you,	and	call	towards	your	
Lord,	and	never	be	among	those	who	
ascribe	partners	(to	Him).
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	hargiz	woh	tumheñ	Allāh	ki	Aayatoñ	
se	na	rokeñ	b’ad	iske	ke	woh	tumhāri	ṭaraf	
utāri	gayiñ	aur	apne	Rab	ki	ṭaraf	bulāō	aur	
hargiz	shirk	wāloñ	meiñ	ne	honā.

arabicText: وَلَا تَدْعُ مَعَ ٱللَّهِ إِلَـٰهًا ءَاخَرَ ۘ لَآ إِلَـٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ ۚ كُلُّ شَىْءٍ هَالِكٌ إِلَّا وَجْهَهُۥ ۚ لَهُ ٱلْحُكْمُ وَإِلَيْهِ تُرْجَعُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	do	not	worship	any	other	God	along	
with	Allah;	there	is	no	God	except	Him;	all	
things	are	destructible	except	His	Entity;	
only	His	is	the	command,	and	it	is	towards	
Him	that	you	will	be	returned.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Allāh	ke	sāth	dosre	khudā	ko	na	pooj	
us	ke	siwā	koi	khudā	nahiñ	har	chiz	fāni	hai	
siwā	us	ki	ƶāt	ke	usi	kā	hukm	hai	aur	usi	ki	
ṭaraaf	phir	jāōge.

arabicText: الٓمٓ
englishTranslationText:
Alif-Lam-Meem*.	(*Alphabets of the 
Arabic language; Allah and to whomever 
He reveals, know their precise meanings.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Alif-Lam-Meem*.	(*Arabi zabān k Huroof 
jinke Ma’āni Allah or Jis par Allah Ta’āla 
ne Inko Nazil Farmaya Wahi Janta hai.)

arabicText: أَحَسِبَ ٱلنَّاسُ أَن يُتْرَكُوٓا۟ أَن يَقُولُوٓا۟ ءَامَنَّا وَهُمْ لَا يُفْتَنُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Do	men	fancy	that	they	will	be	left	just	
upon	their	declaring,	“We	believe”,	and	
they	will	not	be	tested?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kyā	log	is	ghamand	meiñ	haiñ	ke	itni	bāt	
par	chod	diye	jāyeñge	ke	kaheñ	ham	Imān	
lāye	aur	un	ki	āazmāish	na	hogi

arabicText: وَلَقَدْ فَتَنَّا ٱلَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِهِمْ ۖ فَلَيَعْلَمَنَّ ٱللَّهُ ٱلَّذِينَ صَدَقُوا۟ وَلَيَعْلَمَنَّ ٱلْكَـٰذِبِينَ
englishTranslationText:
We	indeed	tested	those	before	them	–	so	Allah	will	surely	test	the	truthful,	and	will	surely	test	
the	liars.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	be-shak	ham	ne	un	se	agloñ	ko	jānchā	to	zaror	Allāh	sachchoñ	ko	dekhe	ga	aur	zaror	jhotoñ	
ko	dekhe	ga.

arabicText: أَمْ حَسِبَ ٱلَّذِينَ يَعْمَلُونَ ٱلسَّيِّـَٔاتِ أَن يَسْبِقُونَا ۚ سَآءَ مَا يَحْكُمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Or	do	they	who	commit	evil	deeds	imagine	that	they	can	escape	from	Us?	What	an	evil	judgement	
they	impose!
romanUrduTranslationText:
Yā	ye	samjhe	hoye	haiñ	woh	jo	bure	kām	karte	haiñ	ke	ham	se	kahiñ	nikal	jāyeñ	ge	kyā	hi	burā	
ḥukm	lgāte	haiñ.

arabicText: مَن كَانَ يَرْجُوا۟ لِقَآءَ ٱللَّهِ فَإِنَّ أَجَلَ ٱللَّهِ لَـَٔاتٍۢ ۚ وَهُوَ ٱلسَّمِيعُ ٱلْعَلِيمُ
englishTranslationText:
Whoever	expects	to	meet	Allah	–	then	indeed	the	time	appointed	by	Allah	will	come;	and	He	is	
the	All	Hearing,	the	All	Knowing.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jise	Allāh	se	milne	ki	ummid	ho	to	be-shak	Allāh	ki	mi’aād	zaror	āane	wāli	hai	aur	wohi	sunta	
jāntā	hai.

arabicText: وَمَن جَـٰهَدَ فَإِنَّمَا يُجَـٰهِدُ لِنَفْسِهِۦٓ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَغَنِىٌّ عَنِ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	whoever	strives	in	Allah's	cause,	strives	only	for	his	own	benefit;	indeed	Allah	is	
Independent	of	the	entire	creation.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jo	Allāh	ki	rāh	meiñ	koshish	kare	to	apne	hi	bhale	ko	koshish	kartā	hai	be-shak	Allāh	be
parwāh	hai	sāre	jahān	se.

arabicText: وَٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ لَنُكَفِّرَنَّ عَنْهُمْ سَيِّـَٔاتِهِمْ وَلَنَجْزِيَنَّهُمْ أَحْسَنَ ٱلَّذِى كَانُوا۟ يَعْمَلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	those	who	accepted	faith	and	did	good	
deeds	-	We	will	indeed	relieve	their	sins	
and	reward	them	for	the	best	of	their	
deeds.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jo	Imān	lāye	aur	achche	kām	kiye	ham	
zaroor	un	ki	burāiyāñ	utār	deñ	ge	aur	zaror	
unheñ	us	kām	par	badla	deñ	ge	jo	un	ke	sab	
kāmoñ	meiñ	achchā	thā.

arabicText: وَوَصَّيْنَا ٱلْإِنسَـٰنَ بِوَٰلِدَيْهِ حُسْنًۭا ۖ وَإِن جَـٰهَدَاكَ لِتُشْرِكَ بِى مَا لَيْسَ لَكَ بِهِۦ عِلْمٌۭ فَلَا تُطِعْهُمَآ ۚ إِلَىَّ مَرْجِعُكُمْ فَأُنَبِّئُكُم بِمَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	upon	man	We	ordained	kindness	
towards	parents;	and	if	they	strive	to	make	
you	ascribe	a	partner	with	Me,	about	
which	you	do	not	have	any	knowledge,	
then	do	not	obey	them;	towards	Me	only	is	
your	return	and	I	will	tell	you	what	you	
used	to	do.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	ham	ne	āadmi	ko	tākid	ki	apne	māñ	
bāp	ke	sāth	bhlāi	ki	aur	agar	woh	tujh	se	
koshish	kareñ	ke	to	merā	sharik	thaḥrāye	
jis	kā	tujhe	‘Ilm	nahiñ	to	un	kā	kahā	na	mān	
meri	hi	ṭaraf	tumhārā	phirnā	hai	to	maiñ	
batā	doñ	ga	tumheñ	jo	tum	karte	the.

arabicText: وَٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ لَنُدْخِلَنَّهُمْ فِى ٱلصَّـٰلِحِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	those	who	accepted	faith	and	did	good	
deeds	-	We	shall	indeed	include	them	
among	the	virtuous.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jo	Imān	lāye	aur	achche	kām	kiye	zaror	
ham	unheñ	nekoñ	meiñ	shāmil	kareñ	ge.

arabicText: وَمِنَ ٱلنَّاسِ مَن يَقُولُ ءَامَنَّا بِٱللَّهِ فَإِذَآ أُوذِىَ فِى ٱللَّهِ جَعَلَ فِتْنَةَ ٱلنَّاسِ كَعَذَابِ ٱللَّهِ وَلَئِن جَآءَ نَصْرٌۭ مِّن رَّبِّكَ لَيَقُولُنَّ إِنَّا كُنَّا مَعَكُمْ ۚ أَوَلَيْسَ ٱللَّهُ بِأَعْلَمَ بِمَا فِى صُدُورِ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	some	people	say,	“We	believe	in	Allah”	–	so	if	they	are	afflicted	with	some	
adversity	in	Allah’s	way,	they	consider	the	
chaos	created	by	men	as	the	punishment	
from	Allah;	and	if	the	help	comes	from	
your	Lord,	they	will	surely	say,	“Indeed	we	
were	with	you”;	does	not	Allah	well	know	
what	is	in	the	hearts	of	the	entire	creation?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	b’az	āadmi	kahte	haiñ	ke	ham	Allāh	
par	Imān	lāye	phir	jab	Allāh	ki	rāh	meiñ	
unheñ	koi	taklif	di	jāti	hai	to	logoñ	ke	fitne	
ko	Allāh	ke	‘aƶāb	ke	barābar	samajhte	haiñ	
aur	agar	tumhāre	Rab	ke	pās	se	madad	
āaye	to	zaror	kaheñ	ge	ham	to	tumhāre	hi	
sāth	the	kyā	Allāh	khoob	nahiñ	jāntā	jo	kuch	jahāñ	bhar	ke	diloñ	meiñ	hai.

arabicText: وَلَيَعْلَمَنَّ ٱللَّهُ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَلَيَعْلَمَنَّ ٱلْمُنَـٰفِقِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	indeed	Allah	will	make	known	the	
believers,	and	indeed	He	will	expose	the	
hypocrites.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	Allāh	zaror	zāhir	kar	degā	Imān	wāloñ	ko	aur	zaror	zāhir	kar	degā	munāfiqoñ	ko.

arabicText: وَقَالَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ لِلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ ٱتَّبِعُوا۟ سَبِيلَنَا وَلْنَحْمِلْ خَطَـٰيَـٰكُمْ وَمَا هُم بِحَـٰمِلِينَ مِنْ خَطَـٰيَـٰهُم مِّن شَىْءٍ ۖ إِنَّهُمْ لَكَـٰذِبُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	the	disbelievers	said	to	the	Muslims,	
“Follow	our	path	and	we	will	bear	your	
sins”;	whereas	they	will	not	bear	anything	from	their	sins;	they	are	indeed	liars.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	kāfir	musalmānoñ	se	bole	hamāri	rāh	par	chalo	aur	ham	tumhāre	gunāh	uthā	leñ	ge	ḥālāñ	ke	
woh	un	ke	gunāhoñ	meiñ	se	kuch	na	uthāyeñ	ge	be-shak	woh	jhoote	haiñ.

arabicText: وَلَيَحْمِلُنَّ أَثْقَالَهُمْ وَأَثْقَالًۭا مَّعَ أَثْقَالِهِمْ ۖ وَلَيُسْـَٔلُنَّ يَوْمَ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ عَمَّا كَانُوا۟ يَفْتَرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	they	will	surely	bear	their	own	burdens	and	some	other	burdens	along	with	their	own;	and	
they	will	undoubtedly	be	questioned	on	the	Day	of	Resurrection	concerning	what	they	had	
fabricated.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	be-shak	zaror	apne	bojh	uthāyeñ	ge	aur	apne	bojhoñ	ke	sāth	aur	bojh	aur	zaror	qiyāmat	ke	
din	pooche	jāyeñ	ge	jo	kuch	buhtān	uthāte	the.

arabicText: وَلَقَدْ أَرْسَلْنَا نُوحًا إِلَىٰ قَوْمِهِۦ فَلَبِثَ فِيهِمْ أَلْفَ سَنَةٍ إِلَّا خَمْسِينَ عَامًۭا فَأَخَذَهُمُ ٱلطُّوفَانُ وَهُمْ ظَـٰلِمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	indeed	We	sent	Nooh	to	his	people	-	he	therefore	stayed	with	them	for	a	thousand	years,	less	
fifty;	so	the	flood	seized	them,	and	they	were	unjust.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	be-shak	ham	ne	Noḥ	ko	us	ki	qaum	ki	ṭaraf	bhejā	to	woh	un	meiñ	pachās	sāl	kam	hazār	baras	
rahā	to	unheñ	ṭofān	ne	āa	liyā	aur	woh	zālim	the.

arabicText: فَأَنجَيْنَـٰهُ وَأَصْحَـٰبَ ٱلسَّفِينَةِ وَجَعَلْنَـٰهَآ ءَايَةًۭ لِّلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	We	rescued	him	and	the	people	
aboard	the	ship,	and	made	the	ship	a	sign	
for	the	entire	world.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	ham	ne	use	aur	kashti	wāloñ	ko	bachā	
liyā	aur	us	kashti	ko	sāre	jahāñ	ke	liye	
nishāni	kyā.

arabicText: وَإِبْرَٰهِيمَ إِذْ قَالَ لِقَوْمِهِ ٱعْبُدُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَٱتَّقُوهُ ۖ ذَٰلِكُمْ خَيْرٌۭ لَّكُمْ إِن كُنتُمْ تَعْلَمُونَ
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Ibrāhim	ko	jab	us	ne	apni	qaum	se	
farmāyā	ke	Allāh	ko	pkojo	aur	us	se	daro	is	
meiñ	tumhārā	bhalā	hai	agar	tum	jānte.

arabicText: إِنَّمَا تَعْبُدُونَ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ أَوْثَـٰنًۭا وَتَخْلُقُونَ إِفْكًا ۚ إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ تَعْبُدُونَ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ لَا يَمْلِكُونَ لَكُمْ رِزْقًۭا فَٱبْتَغُوا۟ عِندَ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرِّزْقَ وَٱعْبُدُوهُ وَٱشْكُرُوا۟ لَهُۥٓ ۖ إِلَيْهِ تُرْجَعُونَ
englishTranslationText:
“You	worship	only	idols	instead	of	Allah,	
and	only	forge	a	clear	lie;	indeed	those	
whom	you	worship	instead	of	Allah	do	not	
control	your	sustenance	–	therefore	seek	
your	sustenance	from	Allah,	and	worship	
Him,	and	be	grateful	to	Him;	it	is	towards	
Him	that	you	will	be	returned.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tum	to	Allāh	ke	siwā	butoñ	ko	poojte	ho	
aur	nirā	jhot	gadhte	ho	be-shak	woh	jinheñ	
tum	Allāh	ke	siwā	poojte	ho	tumhāri	rozi	
ke	kuch	mālik	nahiñ	to	Allāh	ke	pās	rizq	
dhoñdo	aur	us	ki	bandagi	karo	aur	us	kā	
iḥsān	māno	tumheñ	usi	ki	ṭaraf	phirnā	hai

arabicText: وَإِن تُكَذِّبُوا۟ فَقَدْ كَذَّبَ أُمَمٌۭ مِّن قَبْلِكُمْ ۖ وَمَا عَلَى ٱلرَّسُولِ إِلَّا ٱلْبَلَـٰغُ ٱلْمُبِينُ
englishTranslationText:
“And	if	you	deny,	then	many	nations	have	
denied	before	you;	and	the	Noble	
Messenger	is	not	responsible	except	to	
plainly	convey	(the	message).”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	agar	tum	jhutlāō	to	tum	se	pahle	kitne	
hi	giroh	jhutlā	chuke	haiñ	aur	Rasool	ke	
ƶimme	nahiñ	magar	sāf	pahuñchā	denā.

arabicText: أَوَلَمْ يَرَوْا۟ كَيْفَ يُبْدِئُ ٱللَّهُ ٱلْخَلْقَ ثُمَّ يُعِيدُهُۥٓ ۚ إِنَّ ذَٰلِكَ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ يَسِيرٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
Have	they	not	seen	how	Allah	initiates	the	
creation,	then	will	create	it	again?	Indeed	
that	is	easy	for	Allah.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	kyā	unhoñ	ne	na	dekhā	Allāh	kiyuñ	kar	
khalq	ki	ibtidā	farmātā	hai	phir	use	dobāra	
banāye	ga	be-shak	ye	Allāh	ko	āasān	hai.

arabicText: قُلْ سِيرُوا۟ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ فَٱنظُرُوا۟ كَيْفَ بَدَأَ ٱلْخَلْقَ ۚ ثُمَّ ٱللَّهُ يُنشِئُ ٱلنَّشْأَةَ ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةَ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَىْءٍۢ قَدِيرٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
Proclaim	(O	dear	Prophet	Muhammad	-	
peace	and	blessings	be	upon	him),	“Travel	
in	the	land	and	see	how	He	creates	for	the	
first	time,	then	Allah	brings	forth	the	next	
development;	indeed	Allah	is	Able	to	do	all	
things.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tum	farmāō	zameen	meiñ	safar	kar	ke	dekho	Allāh	kiyuñ	kar	pahle	bnātā	hai	phir	Allāh	dosri	
uthān	uthātā	hai	be-shak	Allāh	sab	kuch	kar	saktā	hai.

arabicText: يُعَذِّبُ مَن يَشَآءُ وَيَرْحَمُ مَن يَشَآءُ ۖ وَإِلَيْهِ تُقْلَبُونَ
englishTranslationText:
He	punishes	whomever	He	wills	and	has	mercy	upon	whomever	He	wills;	and	towards	Him	only	
you	are	to	return.
romanUrduTranslationText: Áƶāb	detā	hai	jise	chāhe	aur	raḥam	farmātā	hai	jis	par	chāhe	aur	tumheñ	usi	ki	ṭaraf	phirnā	hai.

arabicText: وَمَآ أَنتُم بِمُعْجِزِينَ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَلَا فِى ٱلسَّمَآءِ ۖ وَمَا لَكُم مِّن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ مِن وَلِىٍّۢ وَلَا نَصِيرٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
Neither	can	you	escape	(from	His	control)	in	the	earth	nor	in	the	sky;	and	for	you,	other	than	Allah,	
there	is	neither	a	friend	nor	a	supporter.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	na	tum	zameen	meiñ	qābo	se	nikal	sako	aur	na	āasmān	meiñ	aur	tumhāre	liye	Allāh	ke	siwā	
na	koi	kām	banane	wālā	aur	na	madadgār.

arabicText: وَٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ بِـَٔايَـٰتِ ٱللَّهِ وَلِقَآئِهِۦٓ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ يَئِسُوا۟ مِن رَّحْمَتِى وَأُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ لَهُمْ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
And	those	who	did	not	believe	in	My	signs	and	in	meeting	Me,	are	those	who	have	no	hope	of	My	
mercy,	and	for	them	is	a	painful	punishment.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	woh	jinhoñ	ne	meri	āayatoñ	aur	mere	milne	ko	na	mānā	woh	haiñ	jinheñ	meri	raḥmat	ki	āas	
nahiñ	aur	un	ke	liye	dard-nāk	áƶāb	hai.

arabicText: فَمَا كَانَ جَوَابَ قَوْمِهِۦٓ إِلَّآ أَن قَالُوا۟ ٱقْتُلُوهُ أَوْ حَرِّقُوهُ فَأَنجَىٰهُ ٱللَّهُ مِنَ ٱلنَّارِ ۚ إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَـٰتٍۢ لِّقَوْمٍۢ يُؤْمِنُونَ
englishTranslationText:
So	his	people	could	not	answer	him	except	
to	say,	“Kill	him	or	burn	him”	–	so	Allah	
rescued	him	from	the	fire;	indeed	in	this	
are	signs	for	people	who	believe.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	us	ki	Qaum	ko	kuch	jawāb	ban	na	āayā	
magar	ye	bole	unheñ	qatl	kar	do	yā	jalā	do	
to	Allāh	ne	use	āag	se	bachā	liyā	be-shak	is	
meiñ	zaror	nishāniyāñ	haiñ	imān	wāloñ	ke	
liye.

arabicText: وَقَالَ إِنَّمَا ٱتَّخَذْتُم مِّن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ أَوْثَـٰنًۭا مَّوَدَّةَ بَيْنِكُمْ فِى ٱلْحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنْيَا ۖ ثُمَّ يَوْمَ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ يَكْفُرُ بَعْضُكُم بِبَعْضٍۢ وَيَلْعَنُ بَعْضُكُم بَعْضًۭا وَمَأْوَىٰكُمُ ٱلنَّارُ وَمَا لَكُم مِّن نَّـٰصِرِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	Ibrahim	said,	“You	have	chosen	only	
idols	instead	of	Allah,	with	whom	your	
friendship	is	only	in	the	life	of	this	world;	
then	on	the	Day	of	Resurrection	you	will	
deny	and	curse	each	other;	and	the	
destination	for	all	of	you	is	hell,	and	you	do	
not	have	supporters.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Ibrāhim	ne	farmāyā	tum	ne	to	Allāh	ke	
siwā	ye	but	banā	liye	haiñ	jin	se	tumhāri	
dosti	yahi	dunyā	ki	zindagi	tak	hai	phir	
qayāmat	ke	din	tum	meiñ	aik	dosre	ke	sāth	
kufr	karegā	aur	aik	dosre	par	l'anat	dālega	
aur	tum	sab	kā	thikānā	jahannam	hai	aur	
tumhārā	koi	madadgār	nahiñ.

arabicText: ۞ فَـَٔامَنَ لَهُۥ لُوطٌۭ ۘ وَقَالَ إِنِّى مُهَاجِرٌ إِلَىٰ رَبِّىٓ ۖ إِنَّهُۥ هُوَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلْحَكِيمُ
englishTranslationText:
So	Lut	believed	in	him;	and	Ibrahim	said,	“I	
migrate	towards	my	Lord;	indeed	only	He	
is	the	Almighty,	the	Wise.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	Lūṭ	us	par	Imān	lāyā	aur	Ibrāhim	ne	
kahā	maiñ	apne	Rab	ki	ṭaraf		hijrat	kartā	
hooñ	be-shak	wohi	'izzat	o	ḥikmat	wālā	
hai.

arabicText: وَوَهَبْنَا لَهُۥٓ إِسْحَـٰقَ وَيَعْقُوبَ وَجَعَلْنَا فِى ذُرِّيَّتِهِ ٱلنُّبُوَّةَ وَٱلْكِتَـٰبَ وَءَاتَيْنَـٰهُ أَجْرَهُۥ فِى ٱلدُّنْيَا ۖ وَإِنَّهُۥ فِى ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ لَمِنَ ٱلصَّـٰلِحِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	We	bestowed	Ishaq	and	Yaqub	to	him,	
and	kept	the	Prophethood	and	the	Book	
among	his	descendants,	and	We	gave	him	
his	reward	in	the	world;	and	in	the	
Hereafter	he	is	indeed	among	those	who	
deserve	Our	proximity.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Ham	ne	usey	Isḥāq	aur	Y'āqoob	'aṭa	farmāye	aur	Ham	ne	us	ki	aulād	meiñ	nubuwwat	aur	
Kitāb	rakhi	aur	ham	ne	duniyā	me	us	kā	sawāb	usey	'aṭā	farmāyā	aur	be-shak	āakhirat	meiñ	woh	
hamāre	qurb-e-khās	ke	sazā	wāroñ	meiñ	hai.

arabicText: وَلُوطًا إِذْ قَالَ لِقَوْمِهِۦٓ إِنَّكُمْ لَتَأْتُونَ ٱلْفَـٰحِشَةَ مَا سَبَقَكُم بِهَا مِنْ أَحَدٍۢ مِّنَ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	We	rescued	Lut	when	he	said	to	his	
people,	“You	indeed	commit	the	shameful;	
such	that	no	one	in	the	creation	has	ever	
done	before	you.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Lūṭ	ko	najāt	di	jab	us	ne	apni	qaum	se	farmāyā	tum	be-shak	be-ḥayāi	kā	kām	karte	ho	ke	tum	
se	pahle	duniyā	bhar	meiñ	kisi	ne	na	kiyā.

arabicText: أَئِنَّكُمْ لَتَأْتُونَ ٱلرِّجَالَ وَتَقْطَعُونَ ٱلسَّبِيلَ وَتَأْتُونَ فِى نَادِيكُمُ ٱلْمُنكَرَ ۖ فَمَا كَانَ جَوَابَ قَوْمِهِۦٓ إِلَّآ أَن قَالُوا۟ ٱئْتِنَا بِعَذَابِ ٱللَّهِ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ ٱلصَّـٰدِقِينَ
englishTranslationText:
“What!	You	commit	the	immoral	with	males,	and	cut	off	the	roads;	and	you	speak	evilly	in	your	
gatherings?”	So	his	people	had	no	answer	except	to	say,	“Bring	the	punishment	of	Allah	upon	us	
if	you	are	truthful!”
romanUrduTranslationText:
kyā	tum	mardoñ	se	bad-fe'ali	karte	ho	aur	rāh	mārte	ho	aur	apni	majlis	meiñ	buri	bāt	karte	ho	to	
us	ki	Qaum	kā	kuch	jawāb	na	huwā	magar	ye	ke	bole	ham	par	Allāh	kā	Áƶāb	lāō	agar	tum	sachche	
ho.

arabicText: قَالَ رَبِّ ٱنصُرْنِى عَلَى ٱلْقَوْمِ ٱلْمُفْسِدِينَ
englishTranslationText: He	submitted,	“My	Lord!	Help	me	against	these	mischievous	people.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Árz	ki	aey	mere	Rab	meri	madad	kar	in	fasādi	logon	par..

arabicText: وَلَمَّا جَآءَتْ رُسُلُنَآ إِبْرَٰهِيمَ بِٱلْبُشْرَىٰ قَالُوٓا۟ إِنَّا مُهْلِكُوٓا۟ أَهْلِ هَـٰذِهِ ٱلْقَرْيَةِ ۖ إِنَّ أَهْلَهَا كَانُوا۟ ظَـٰلِمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	when	Our	sent	angels	came	with	glad	
tidings	to	Ibrahim,	they	said,	“We	will	
surely	destroy	the	people	of	that	town;	
indeed	its	inhabitants	are	unjust.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jab	hamāre	Farishte	Ibrāhim	ke	pās	
muzda	le	kar	āaye	bole	ham	zaror	is	shahar	
wāloñ	ko	halāk	kareñ	ge	be-shak	is	ke	
basne	wāle	sitamgār	haiñ.

arabicText: قَالَ إِنَّ فِيهَا لُوطًۭا ۚ قَالُوا۟ نَحْنُ أَعْلَمُ بِمَن فِيهَا ۖ لَنُنَجِّيَنَّهُۥ وَأَهْلَهُۥٓ إِلَّا ٱمْرَأَتَهُۥ كَانَتْ مِنَ ٱلْغَـٰبِرِينَ
englishTranslationText:
He	said,	"Lut	is	in	it!”;	they	said,	“We	know	
very	well	who	all	are	there;	we	shall	rescue	
him	and	his	family,	except	his	wife;	she	is	
of	those	who	will	stay	behind.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kahā	is	meiñ	to	Lūṭ	hai	Farishte	bole	
hameñ	khoob	maloom	hai	jo	kuch	us	meiñ	
hai	zaror	ham	usey	aur	us	ke	ghar	wāloñ	
ko	najāt	deñ	ge	mgar	us	ki	'aurat	ko	woh	
rah	jāne	wāloñ	meiñ	hai.

arabicText: وَلَمَّآ أَن جَآءَتْ رُسُلُنَا لُوطًۭا سِىٓءَ بِهِمْ وَضَاقَ بِهِمْ ذَرْعًۭا وَقَالُوا۟ لَا تَخَفْ وَلَا تَحْزَنْ ۖ إِنَّا مُنَجُّوكَ وَأَهْلَكَ إِلَّا ٱمْرَأَتَكَ كَانَتْ مِنَ ٱلْغَـٰبِرِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	when	Our	sent	angels	came	to	Lut,	he	
was	unhappy	at	their	arrival	and	was	
depressed	–	and	they	said,	“Do	not	fear	or	
grieve;	we	will	surely	rescue	you	and	your	
family,	except	your	wife,	who	is	of	those	
who	will	stay	behind.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jab	hamāre	Farishte	Lūṭ	ke	pās	āaye	un	
kā	āanā	use	nāgwār	huā	aur	un	ke	sabab	dil	
tang	huwā	aur	unhoñ	ne	kahā	na	dariye	
aur	na	gham	kijiye	be-shak	ham	āap	ko	aur	
āap	ke	ghar	wāloñ	ko	najāt	deñge	magar	
āap	ki	'aurat	woh	rah	jāne	wāloñ	meiñ	hai.

arabicText: إِنَّا مُنزِلُونَ عَلَىٰٓ أَهْلِ هَـٰذِهِ ٱلْقَرْيَةِ رِجْزًۭا مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ بِمَا كَانُوا۟ يَفْسُقُونَ
englishTranslationText:
“We	will	indeed	cause	a	punishment	from	
the	sky	to	descend	upon	the	inhabitants	of	
this	town	–	the	recompense	of	their	
disobedience.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	ham	is	shahar	wāloñ	par	āasmān	
se	'aƶāb	utārne	wāle	haiñ	badla	in	ki	nā
farmāniyoñ	kā.

arabicText: وَلَقَد تَّرَكْنَا مِنْهَآ ءَايَةًۢ بَيِّنَةًۭ لِّقَوْمٍۢ يَعْقِلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	We	have	undoubtedly	kept	a	part	of	it	
as	a	clear	sign	for	people	of	intellect.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	be-shak	ham	ne	is	se	roshan	nishāni	bāqi	rakhi	'aql	wāloñ	ke	liye.

arabicText: وَإِلَىٰ مَدْيَنَ أَخَاهُمْ شُعَيْبًۭا فَقَالَ يَـٰقَوْمِ ٱعْبُدُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَٱرْجُوا۟ ٱلْيَوْمَ ٱلْـَٔاخِرَ وَلَا تَعْثَوْا۟ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ مُفْسِدِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	We	sent	towards	Madyan,	their	
fellowman	Shuaib	–	he	therefore	said,	“O	
my	people!	Worship	Allah,	and	anticipate	
the	Last	Day,	and	do	not	roam	the	earth	
spreading	turmoil.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Madyan	ki	ṭaraf	un	ke	ham	qaum	Shu'aib	ko	bhejā	to	us	ne	farmāyā	aey	meri	qaum	Allāh	ki	
bandagi	karo	aur	pichle	din	ki	ummid	rakho	aur	zameen	meiñ	fasād	phailāte	na	phiro.

arabicText: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَأَخَذَتْهُمُ ٱلرَّجْفَةُ فَأَصْبَحُوا۟ فِى دَارِهِمْ جَـٰثِمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
In	response	they	denied	him	–	thereupon	the	earthquake	seized	them	–	so	at	morning	they	
remained	lying	flattened	in	their	homes.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	unhoñ	ne	use	jhutlāyā	to	unheñ	zalzale	ne	āa	liyā	to	subaḥ	apne	gharoñ	meiñ	ghutnoñ	ke	bal	
pade	rah	gaye.

arabicText: وَعَادًۭا وَثَمُودَا۟ وَقَد تَّبَيَّنَ لَكُم مِّن مَّسَـٰكِنِهِمْ ۖ وَزَيَّنَ لَهُمُ ٱلشَّيْطَـٰنُ أَعْمَـٰلَهُمْ فَصَدَّهُمْ عَنِ ٱلسَّبِيلِ وَكَانُوا۟ مُسْتَبْصِرِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	We	destroyed	the	A’ad	and	the	Thamud,	and	you	already	know	their	dwellings;	Satan	made	
their	deeds	appear	good	to	them	and	prevented	them	from	the	path,	whereas	they	could	perceive.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	áād	aur	samod	ko	halāk	farmāyā	aur	tumheñ	un	ki	bastiyañ	m'alom	ho	chuki	haiñ	aur	shaiṭān	
ne	un	ke	kotak	(kartot)	un	ki	nigāh	meiñ	bhale	kar	dikhaye	aur	unheñ	rāh	se	rokā	aur	unheñ	
soojhtā	thā.

arabicText: وَقَـٰرُونَ وَفِرْعَوْنَ وَهَـٰمَـٰنَ ۖ وَلَقَدْ جَآءَهُم مُّوسَىٰ بِٱلْبَيِّنَـٰتِ فَٱسْتَكْبَرُوا۟ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَمَا كَانُوا۟ سَـٰبِقِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	(We	destroyed)	Qaroon,	Firaun	and	
Haman;	and	indeed	Moosa	came	to	them	
with	clear	signs,	so	they	were	arrogant	in	
the	land,	and	they	could	never	escape	from	
Our	control.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	qāroon	aur	fir’aun	aur	hāmān	ko	aur	
be-shak	un	ke	pās	Mūsā	roshan	nishāniyāñ	
le	kar	āayā	to	unhoñ	ne	zameen	meiñ	
takabbur	kiyā	aur	woh	ham	se	nikal	jāne	
wāle	na	the.

arabicText: فَكُلًّا أَخَذْنَا بِذَنۢبِهِۦ ۖ فَمِنْهُم مَّنْ أَرْسَلْنَا عَلَيْهِ حَاصِبًۭا وَمِنْهُم مَّنْ أَخَذَتْهُ ٱلصَّيْحَةُ وَمِنْهُم مَّنْ خَسَفْنَا بِهِ ٱلْأَرْضَ وَمِنْهُم مَّنْ أَغْرَقْنَا ۚ وَمَا كَانَ ٱللَّهُ لِيَظْلِمَهُمْ وَلَـٰكِن كَانُوٓا۟ أَنفُسَهُمْ يَظْلِمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
So	We	caught	each	one	upon	his	sin;	so	
among	them	is	one	upon	whom	We	sent	a	
shower	of	stones;	and	among	them	is	one	
who	was	seized	by	the	Scream;	and	among	
them	is	one	whom	We	buried	in	the	earth,	
and	among	them	is	one	whom	We	
drowned;	it	did	not	befit	Allah’s	Majesty	to	
oppress	them,	but	they	were	wronging	
themselves.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	un	meiñ	har	aik	ko	ham	ne	us	ke	gunāh	
par	pakdā	to	un		meiñ	kisi	par	Ham	ne	
pathrāō	bhejā	aur	un	meiñ	kisi	ko	chinghād	
ne	āa	liyā	aur	un	meiñ	kisi	ko	zameen	meiñ	
dhañsā	diyā	aur	un	meiñ	kisi	ko	dubo	diyā	
aur	Allāḥ	ki	shān	na	thi	ke	un	par	zulm	kare	
hāñ	wo	khud	hi	apni	jānoñ	par	zulm	karte	
the.

arabicText: مَثَلُ ٱلَّذِينَ ٱتَّخَذُوا۟ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ أَوْلِيَآءَ كَمَثَلِ ٱلْعَنكَبُوتِ ٱتَّخَذَتْ بَيْتًۭا ۖ وَإِنَّ أَوْهَنَ ٱلْبُيُوتِ لَبَيْتُ ٱلْعَنكَبُوتِ ۖ لَوْ كَانُوا۟ يَعْلَمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
The	example	of	those	who	choose	masters	
other	than	Allah	is	like	that	of	the	spider;	it	
makes	the	web	its	house;	and	indeed	the	
weakest	house	of	all	is	that	of	the	spider;	if	
only	they	knew.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Un	ki	misāl	jinhoñ	ne	Allāh	ke	siwā	aur	
mālik	banā	liye	haiñ	makdi	ki	ṭaraḥ	hai	us	
ne	jāle	kā	ghar	banāyā	aur	be-shak	sab	gharoñ	meiñ	kamzor	ghar	makdi	kā	ghar	kyā	achchā	hotā	
agar	jānte.

arabicText: إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ يَعْلَمُ مَا يَدْعُونَ مِن دُونِهِۦ مِن شَىْءٍۢ ۚ وَهُوَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلْحَكِيمُ
englishTranslationText:
Allah	knows	what	they	worship	instead	of	
Him;	He	is	the	Almighty,	the	Wise.
romanUrduTranslationText: Allāh	jāntā	hai	jis	chiz	ki	us	ke	siwā	poojā	karte	haiñ	aur	wohi	'Izzat-o-ḥikmat	wālā	hai.

arabicText: وَتِلْكَ ٱلْأَمْثَـٰلُ نَضْرِبُهَا لِلنَّاسِ ۖ وَمَا يَعْقِلُهَآ إِلَّا ٱلْعَـٰلِمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	We	illustrate	these	examples	for	
mankind;	and	none	except	the	
knowledgeable	understand	them.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	ye	misāleñ	ham	logon	ke	liye	bayān	farmāte	haiñ	aur	unheñ	nahiñ	samajhte	magar	'ilm	wāle.

arabicText: خَلَقَ ٱللَّهُ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضَ بِٱلْحَقِّ ۚ إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَةًۭ لِّلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
englishTranslationText: Allah	created	the	heavens	and	the	earth	with	the	truth;	indeed	in	this	is	a	sign	for	the	Muslims
romanUrduTranslationText: Allāh	ne	āasmān	aur	zameen	ḥaq	banāye	be-shak	is	meiñ	nishāni	hai	musalmānoñ	ke	liye.

arabicText: ٱتْلُ مَآ أُوحِىَ إِلَيْكَ مِنَ ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ وَأَقِمِ ٱلصَّلَوٰةَ ۖ إِنَّ ٱلصَّلَوٰةَ تَنْهَىٰ عَنِ ٱلْفَحْشَآءِ وَٱلْمُنكَرِ ۗ وَلَذِكْرُ ٱللَّهِ أَكْبَرُ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ يَعْلَمُ مَا تَصْنَعُونَ
englishTranslationText:
O	dear	Prophet	(Muhammad	–	peace	and	blessings	be	upon	him),	recite	from	the	Book	which	has	
been	sent	down	to	you,	and	establish	the	prayer;	indeed	the	prayer	stops	from	indecency	and	
evil;	and	indeed	the	remembrance	of	Allah	is	the	greatest;	and	Allah	knows	all	what	you	do.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	Maḥboob	padho	jo	Kitāb	tumhāri	ṭaraf	waḥi ki	gayi	aur	namāz	qāim	farmāo	be-shak	Namāz	
man’a	karti	hai	be-ḥayāi	aur	buri	bāt	se	aur	be-shak	Allāh	kā	ƶikr	sab	se	badā	aur	Allāh	jāntā	hai	
jo	tum	karte	ho.
